items.content:
Project Manager

Full-time
US Based
Remote job
Small business
Posted Today – Accepting applications
Chromatic in a Nutshell 

Chromatic is a digital agency with over a decade of experience creating websites using open source technologies and a recognized leader in open source content management systems.  We’ve helped some of the web’s biggest brands solve hard problems in publishing, e-commerce, and non-profit spaces. We provide leadership and expertise to our clients through design, back-end development, and automation.

Role Summary
We are looking for a qualified digital project manager to join our team. You will be supporting the day-to-day management and smooth operation of a wide variety of projects and support retainers across the organization.

Typical Day in the Life
This is a boots on the ground position. This project manager will be on the front lines of Chromatic’s projects, ranging from enterprise site builds to monthly maintenance retainers. A typical day in the life of this PM will consist of attending status meetings, recording decisions, and creating and delivering project health/status reports to clients and Chromatic leadership. This person will work alongside our Director of Client Services to ensure the success of our projects and to maintain/grow our client relations.
 
Responsibilities
  • Monitor and report on project budgets and hours.
  • Monitor team and contractor timesheets.
  • Coordinate and schedule meetings.
  • Following up on tasks and open items.
  • Quality assurance support for all deliverables.
  • Produce various reports (status reports, budget, etc.).
  • Contribute to project documentation (i.e. Project Briefs, Functional Requirements, etc).
  • Create agendas and facilitate meetings.
  • General marketing and writing support as needed.
  • Identify and refine out of scope client needs.
  • Provide assistance with resourcing projects.
  • Enthusiasm, personality, teamwork and a positive attitude count tremendously. Serious candidates will be sure to include an introductory video with their application.
 
The right person for this role…
  • Has proven work experience (at least 2-3 years) as a project manager or coordinator (or similar role) within digital services.
  • Can deftly manage their time (and others’).
  • Can juggle multiple initiatives at once.
  • Loves lists and spreadsheets.
  • Has excellent communication skills - both written and verbal.
  • Has a keen attention to detail.
  • Is a problem solver.
  • Is never afraid to ask questions.
  • Learns to anticipate client and team needs.
  • Is self-motivated with a strong work ethic.
  • Is comfortable leading discussions, even the hard ones.
  • Is eager to learn and own projects end-to-end.
  • Is rarely defensive with others.
  • Has hands-on experience with ticketing systems such as Jira or GitHub.

Some Other Important Traits
  • Chromatic is a distributed team  – strong communication skills, both verbal and written, are of the utmost importance.
  • The desire and ability to brainstorm ideas, do research, remain current with industry trends and best practices.
  • Enthusiasm, personality, teamwork and a positive attitude count tremendously. 
  • Serious candidates will be sure to include a short, introductory video with their application. Don’t overthink it.

What sets Chromatic apart from a typical job?
  • Work from wherever you want, whenever you want: Our office is completely distributed, you may work from wherever is most effective for you. We encourage our team members to work when it is most effective so they’ll do their best work, but we tend to schedule meetings during the North American workday and expect our team to usually be available during this time.
  • Reasonable Bookings: We book our team members with a max of 30-35 hours per week for project work. We believe more than that is asking too much. The other 5-10 hours is reserved for team meetings, community contribution, and professional/skill development.
  • Vacation: Chromatic does not set rigid vacation limits. We encourage our people to take vacation when they want/need it. So long as it is planned and doesn’t interfere with existing contracts or project deadlines, we’re all for it.
  • Sabbaticals: Chromatic offers a sabbatical to all full-time employees after their seventh anniversary. Our sabbaticals are intended to allow team members extended time to rest both their bodies and their minds away from work and outside of normal vacation/PTO time and are accompanied by a sabbatical stipend.
  • Health Insurance: Chromatic provides competitive medical/dental/vision insurance.
  • 401(k): Chromatic provides employees a 401(k) plan along with a 3% employer contribution with immediate vesting.
  • Disability Insurance: Chromatic provides both short and long term disability insurance.
  • Life Insurance: All employees are provided with a term life insurance policy.
  • Donation Matching: Chromatic is proud to offer a Donation Matching Program for our team members. We will match donations to a 501(c)3 organization dollar for dollar, up to $50 per month for a total of $600 annually.
  • Hardware: Chromatic allows our team members to choose the system that they prefer and we ensure everyone has up-to-date equipment/software.
  • Exciting Projects: Chromatic consistently participates in projects with exciting, high-profile brands and some of the most highly trafficked sites on the web; some of which include Outside Magazine, Martha Stewart, NBC / MSNBC, Shape, Casper, State Farm, Adobe.
  • Conferences: Chromatic frequently sends team members to attend and speak at industry conferences. Employees are encouraged to seek out conference opportunities to grow their skills and personal networks. 
  • Company Retreat: Once a year, we gather the entire company to spend quality time together away from our desks – usually somewhere quite beautiful.
  • Streaming Music Subscription: Music is important to us; we provide a Spotify subscription (or equivalent) for all of our employees.
  • Workflow: We firmly believe in a strong, consistent deployment workflow. We insist on proper code reviews on all of our projects. This not only ensures excellent code quality but more so, makes us all better at our jobs.
  • Team & Culture: We work and support each other as a team. We make an effort to get together as often as possible and support each other personally and professionally at every opportunity.
  • Flexible Work Week: Chromatic offers a flexible work week schedule for interested team members when clients/project specifics allow it.

Job Description

Flexible upon global location, remote or Uppsala, Sweden

When you’re part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, you ll do challenging work, and be part of a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. With revenues of more than $24 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.

Location/Division Specific Information
The ImmunoDiagnostics Division (IDD) develops, manufactures, and markets complete blood test systems to support the clinical diagnosis and monitoring of allergy, asthma and autoimmune diseases. With 1,800 employees worldwide, IDD is the global leader in in vitro allergy testing and also the European leader in autoimmunity diagnostics. The allergy and autoimmunity product lines operate on a common automated instrument platform, Phadia Laboratory Systems, which supports both productivity and cost efficiencies in clinical laboratories around the world.

How will you make an impact?
The Global Marketing Operations Manager is tasked with driving the global marketing operations strategies across the global and regional organizations. They will play an active role in the enhancement of all marketing operations in order to facilitate lead generation, nurturing, and implementation that arise from the global marketing activities.

The position of the Marketing Operations Manager is also collaborative and, as such, the occupier of this position works closely with the commercial marketing organizations as well as the finance department in ensuring optimal exploitation of the marketing budget in achieving targeted revenue outcomes relative to our Annual Operating Plan (AOP). The Marketing Operations Manager coordinates with market strategist in the creation and management of marketing campaign process for the purpose of driving leads from both customers, consumers and prospective consumers.

For tactics, activities and assets developed by the global marketing organization, the Marketing Operations Manager will interface with the IDD Digital Experience Team to support the implementation of ongoing key systems such as Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) for all activities managed by the Global Marketing Operations Team such as trade shows, congresses, VIPs.

The Marketing Operations Manager will coordinate with the senior marketing management in consultation and management of both offline and online multichannel marketing.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Key interface and coordination between: product marketing, demand generation, product management, public relations, graphic design as well as the IDD executive team one unified/coordinated look, feel and voice for all marketing communication efforts
  • Lead discussions with regional and global marketing teams on effective asset/program creation and success tracking techniques then convert these plans to a joint roadmap ahead of defining our AOP in other words, coordination of marketing activities and plans pre AOP.
  • Deliver and manage reporting and analytics that shows how integrated marketing programs and customer engagement impact revenue generation directly and indirectly.
  • Manages marketing metrics, inputting these measurements into reports that measure the performance of the marketing team as a whole.
  • Ownership of the Thermo Fisher Scientific ImmunoDiagnostics brand across all public facing marketing channels
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

How will you get here?
Educational Qualifications:

  • The Marketing Operations Manager will have at minimum a bachelor’s degree in a business related, healthcare or technical field such as Marketing, Information Technology, Public Relations, Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, Computer Science, or any other related field.

Professional Experience Qualifications:

  • A minimum of 4 years marketing/operations experience is required healthcare preferred.
  • Demonstrated strategic thinking, including the ability to develop actionable, comprehensive project plans and then execute them to successful completion
  • Experience utilizing established business tools and/or other process/project-management techniques are strongly preferred and strong project management skills required.
  • Demonstrated ability to operate independently, to take initiative, be resourceful, and exercise astute business judgment to drive execution.
  • Demonstrated success in collaborating cross-functionally in a matrix environment.
  • Must have excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written skills in English to effectively communicate with the senior level
  • Extensive knowledge of MS Office applications is required

We hope that you are interested in becoming a part of a constantly growing, changing and global company. We can offer an interesting and challenging position in an international environment.

Job description

Analytics Fire builds custom software for the solar power industry. We’re looking for a collaborative but hands-on Release Manager to help us scale our execution to support additional new high-tech sectors.

Analytics Fire is a deeply technical engineering organization. Most of us are software engineers and spend the majority of our time on heads down engineering activities like coding. Our goal in creating this position is to expand our small client-facing team with a unique person that has both the personality and the technical skillset to help guide software releases through planning, development, deployment, release, and DevOps processes.

This position is similar to that of a technical Program Manager, but you will be much more involved in the technical details and hurdles around software deployments and releases than a traditional Project Manager would be. Our ideal candidate is a current or former Software Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or Site Reliability Engineer that is willing to be trained in formal Program Management processes (or has already been trained in formal Program Management processes).

As a small company, Analytics Fire is able to tailor roles around the strengths of our individual team members. We will tailor this role to your specific technical background. However, it is a hard requirement that you are able to support the following 3 types of responsibilities:

  • (a) Represent Analytics Fire software engineering teams in client-facing interactions (clarifying requirements, negotiating technical approaches, reporting on status, etc).
  • (b) Technical writing responsibilities such as documenting requirements, project plans, system architecture, etc.
  • (c) Making meaningful contributions to the execution of complex software projects.

For reference, here is a list of some technologies we are currently actively using on a day-to-day basis:

  • JavaScript: React / Angular / Typescript / GraphQL
  • Back-end: Ruby / Python / Node
  • Embedded (IoT): C, Embedded Linux, MQTT
  • Embedded (robotics): C/C++, ROS
  • Modern software techniques: RESTful APIs, SOA, PaaS, etc
  • Agile collaboration and DevOps tools: Github, Trello, Slack, Chef, Ansible, Docker, Vagrant, etc
  • Other technologies we are currently building with: AWS, GCP, TensorFlow, OpenCV, Yocto, Salesforce platform, iOS, ARKit

Description of responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain well-coordinated relationships with key internal and client-side stakeholders to help drive decision making around production software releases and DevOps.
  • Participate in collaborative planning discussions and technical decision making early in the project lifecycle to ensure that key decisions are made with reliability, testability, and DevOps in mind.
  • Monitor and oversee coordination, integration, flow of development, testing, and deployment around multiple parallel projects and threads of engineering execution.
  • Drive planning and delivery of high quality software releases:
    • Manage change control process during releases
    • Continuously improve company release processes
    • Proactively identify and mitigate risks and remove obstacles to releases
  • Personally plan and participate in software release activities. Advise and support the team so that they can take on less critical releases on a day-to-day basis.
  • Continually integrate the QA team and testing engineers into both the requirements gathering and software development processes and report status to clients on a very frequent basis.

This is a remote position but is only open to candidates living in the US or Canada. (Note: we may be open to US or Canadian citizens living abroad in US-overlapping time zones on a case by case basis.) We’re flexible about location and hours. We’re a really great match for candidate who wants to work hard on interesting projects, while also having flexibility around time and geography.

Skills & Requirements

“Must have” requirements:

  • Soft skills necessary to develop and maintain well-coordinated relationships with key internal and client-side stakeholders to help drive decision making around production software releases and DevOps.
  • 3+ years hands experience as a full stack Software Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or Site Reliability Engineer, ideally within a commercial startup environment.
  • Familiarity with current modern best practices around software development, data engineering, and DevOps
  • Ability and willingness to familiarize yourself with the specific technical stacks that we use.
  • Superior organization and detail orientation.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Willingness to design, document, and evangelize new engineering processes to meet evolving organizational requirements.

“Nice to have” requirements:

  • Hands-on technical experience writing code in Ruby, Python, or JavaScript
  • Previous experience as a technical Program Manager.
Apply now

Analytics Fire was founded by a couple of data-nerds -- one a PHd in machine learning and the other a former VP of Engineering for an analytics platform -- who both are also serial entrepreneurs backed by prominent angels and VCs including Y Combinator and 500 Startups.

“We founded Analytics Fire to create the engineering department that we always dreamed of working for. To us that means being able to spend our time working on interesting technical problems, while simultaneously having flexibility around time and geography and being part of a small, tightly-knit team of world-class engineers."

As part of our team, your voice matters, and you will do important work that has impact, on people, businesses and nations. Our industry and our company move fast, and you can be sure that you will always have room to learn and grow. We re proud of our team and the important work we do to build confidence for a more connected world. Technical Account Managers will be the ingestion point for client escalations and concerns and will support the Director of Client Engagement in the technical remediation of client escalations for the client s they are assigned to. Therefore, a strong command of cyber operations technical and procedural concepts with an in-depth understanding of relevant frameworks, compliance, and regulatory requirements. The Technical Account Manager leads and directs multiple, technical engagements across one or more clients under limited supervision. The Technical Account Manager manages strategic technical engagements from inception to completion, identifying and documenting requirements, supporting clients on various information security initiatives, keeping all stakeholders apprised of progress and status, and managing issues to resolution. Technical Account Managers are responsible for the oversight and delivery of tailored outcomes to meet client needs over the contract life-cycle (Assessment, Design, Implementation, Operation, Optimization). Technical Account Managers are expected to build trust and relationships with clients and leadership through the delivery of successful outcomes. Finally, the Technical Account Manager will own, develop and support key process indicators to understand client satisfaction. This includes repeatable measurement of client satisfaction KPIs and working across Optiv Technical Teams at the direction of the Director to facilitate operational corrective actions needed to address tactical and systemic client satisfaction issues. In addition, the Technical Account Manager believes and lives the Cyber Operations guiding principles Deliver quality security outcomes Drive efficient and timely operations Actualize continual improvement and innovation Protect the customer How you ll make an impact Actively participate in a 24x7 delivery team, which may include on-call and weekend work Account management Lifecycle Management Conduct Business Review Sessions with clients Client Risk KRI development and reporting Client Satisfaction KPI development and reporting Thoroughly understand the clients ongoing security needs and assist the Cyber Operations service delivery teams to cover all client operational and strategic meetings Communicate With stakeholders on project performance and project issues. Conduct and coordinate meetings and provide project update summaries Client concerns, questions and conflicts to sales and service delivery teams. Generate and distribute status reports and lead meetings to disseminate appropriate information to stakeholders. Review and lead clarification of project scope captured in the services statement of work and working closely with the customer and sales to identify specific customer requirements. Clearly set expectations in order to align the stakeholders and team members Mentor junior members of the team Other duties as assigned. Escalation Management Negotiation and Conflict Resolution Executive Reporting and Presentation Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proven problem identification and resolution strategies Proven ability to take proactive steps to protect Optiv and the client from issues and risks Proven approach to proactively monitor and report on timelines and deliverables Ability to build and develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders PREFERRED SKILLS At least one certification in Security including Security+, GSEC, GCIA, GCIH, CISSP, CISM or another security-specific vendorproduct certifications. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Bachelor s Degree from four-year college or university in Information Technology, Information SecurityAssurance, Engineering or similar area of study at least 5 years related experience andor training or equivalent combination of education and experience preferred. Demonstrated understanding of Information Security required. Demonstrated understanding of multiple Cyber Operations functional areas threat analysis, intelligence operations, SIEM, security technology management, identity, risk and threat assessment, etc. Demonstrated understanding of the NIST CSF, MITRE ATTCK framework, CARTA, ISO, PCI, SOC 2, etc. Demonstrated understanding of multiple cyber security platforms SIEM, firewall, UTM, IDPS, Endpoint Security, vulnerability scanning, identity solutions, etc. 5+ years of experience in a technical role as an engineer, analyst, architect, integrator, etc. 5+ years of experience in a customer facing projectprogram delivery leadership role within a professional services or consulting organization 3+ years of experience with cloud providers AWS, GCP, Azure, etc. 3+ years of experience with virtualization and or containerization Security Project Management expertise specifically demonstrated success managing multiple clients and disparate initiatives on a long term-basis. Experience interfacing with both clients and partners. Excellent written and verbal communication, time management and organizational skills Superior problem-solving skills Ability to work as a team player, with strong interpersonal and communication skills Adept in planning, leading change management, working in a fast-paced environment, and multi-tasking skills Why you ll love it here If you are seeking a culture that supports growth, fosters success and moves the industry forward, find your place at Optiv! Optiv s mission is to deliver comprehensive, integrated cybersecurity programs to optimize customer security programs to be more effective, efficient, manageable and measurable. Our aim is to become the world s largest cybersecurity solutions integrator by leveraging our expertise in security technology, market-leading services, and innovative approaches. We have served more than 12,000 clients of various sizes across multiple industries, we offer an extensive geographic footprint, and have premium partnerships with more than 350 of the leading security product manufacturers. Optiv is a privately-held company backed by KKR, a leading global private equity firm. With Optiv you can expect An entrepreneurial and collaborative environment A competitive total rewards program Professional training opportunities Engaging and fun culture Opportunity to work with industry leading, talented peers

exceptional new team member to join us.

project to launch one of their programs to the world. The last project we worked on was Coach

Master Toolkit, see https://www.wbecs.com/cmt/program/. The next two projects you would start

https://wbecs.com/wbecs19.

Our mission at WBECS is to raise the global standard of coaching by providing executive coaches

with the highest quality content available in the industry. WBECS is a growing remote global

workforce, we are truly passionate about our people!

This is not your typical office job. Our passionately engaged team works 100% remote and collaborates

vigorously. "We consider ourselves as family and here's an inside look at some of the family

fun." The lifestyle design is flexible, but full on and the culture is fast-paced. We consider our work

our “art” and strive for excellence in everything we do.

marketing efforts behind major launches of high class educational programs and learning environments

incredible launch team -- and must have experience planning, building marketing campaigns and

have extensive experience in Digital Marketing & Management.

About The Role

This is an exciting opportunity to have a huge impact on a small team! You will be the leader on the

team responsible for marketing. You will be joining a company that is growing incredibly quickly

and your job will be to help accelerate our growth. You will develop data-driven and creative

marketing programs to grow the number of leads and users on our platform. We are looking for a

marketer with multi-channel expertise who can be a key contributor to our strategy and growth.

multiple time zones while collaborating and partnering with organizational team members,

external partners, and clients.

• Excellent leadership, interpersonal and communication skills required to coach, mentor, and

lead individuals and/or teams.

• Supervision of the copywriters for the creation of key messages - according to the launch

communication strategy

• Coordination with other team members (Tech, IFS automation manager, copy, design) to

complete successful launches

• Simultaneously manage multiple tasks and projects within tight timeframes while

maintaining keen and careful attention to detail.

www.wbecs.com

Experience/Qualifications

• Bachelor's degree in Marketing and other related disciplines (from a recognized Educational

Institution)

• 3 to 4 years of Experience in Marketing Automation (InfusionSoft)

• 3 to 4 years of Experience in planning & leading campaigns across multiple channels

• 3+ years leading and working within a team.

• Resourceful & capable of self-managing and multitasking in fast paced environment

• Data & report driven, is meticulous with details

• Able to manage competing priorities

• Adaptable & ambitious

• Speak, read and write English at an idiomatic level

Other Requirements

• Reliable high-speed internet connection

• Flexibility to work with multiple time zones

References

3 direct references from the current or immediately previous role

Compensation

Competitive with bonuses and unlimited growth opportunities.

PLUS the most unique work environment that includes bonuses in the form of amazing trips to

countries like Costa Rica, Thailand, Croatia, and beyond as a reward for successful launches!

Most importantly you will be working with our team that considers itself a family of people who will

welcome you with open arms.

To apply

Please send:

1. Answers to the questions listed here: Questionnaire for Marketing Project Manager

2. A cover letter explaining why you are an excellent fit for this role and this epic team

3. Your resume to Colleen@wbecs.com with the subject line: Marketing Project Manager

Note:

Applicants who do not submit a cover letter with their application will not be considered.

This position is 100% remote as we are a global team! Primary working hours are US Eastern

Time based and will require flexible hours during program launches.

We will be setting up interviews immediately. Thank you!

IT Manager at Cloudbeds

Remote | International
  • San Diego, CA
  • Full Time
  • IT Operations
  • Experienced

Cloudbeds is a travel industry startup that works to make the world a more welcome place. We make advanced cloud-based hospitality software for hotels, hostels, vacation rentals and groups that manages reservations and guests, distributes room availability, sells inventory, and collects payments. Our hundreds of team members are distributed across over 30 countries and, altogether, we speak 20+ languages. How do we do it? On a #remotefirst platform that allows every member of our team to work from wherever they are around the globe. We’re looking for people who want to disrupt the travel industry and love to travel as much as we do.

Cloudbeds is searching for an experienced IT Manager who can implement, maintain and expand a company BYOD policy for a growing and expanding remote workforce with employees and contractors in over 30 countries. In addition to BYOD, the company also has some company-owned devices on-premise and remote that need to be maintained. The ideal candidate will have experience and skills in rolling out new hardware and software policies, developing endpoint security policies and following best practices in endpoint security, performing network maintenance, and implementing IT growth plans and managing IT infrastructure across a mixed environment of various devices including personal computers and mobile. You must be highly skilled and capable in the areas of endpoint security, accountability, crisis management, and issue prioritization.

Location: This role can be based anywhere! (However, having the ability to sync with multiple Time Zones (Europe, North America is important. Eastern Time Zone is preferable).

What You Will Do:

  • Support IT-related operations and security initiatives
  • Administer third-party services for Engineering, Support, and Sales Teams
  • IT tasks related to Onboarding/Offboarding employees and contractors
  • Employee / contractor access control management for our own SaaS application
  • Support driving technical initiatives across the company such as BYOD and access management
  • Support internal hardware processes and allocation
  • Helping to implement the IT policy and best practice guidelines for the organization
  • Design IT training programs and workshops for staff
  • Helping operations and security teams to conduct regular system audits of internal process and systems
  • Evaluate and manage vendor relationships to solve technical challenges
  • Experience managing and administering GSuite users and documents via the Google Admin Console
  • Manage and report on allocation of IT budget
  • Identifying opportunities for team training and skills advancement
  • Support implementation of security policies and regular assessment of such policies
  • Manage equipment and software inventory, purchasing, and licensing
  • Implement IT training and certification programs for staff

You’ll Succeed With:

  • Several years (5+) of Industry Experience
  • Experience supporting IT operations in a remote and global company
  • Hands-on experience with computer hardware, software, and network systems
  • Experience supporting various operating systems, including Windows, OSX, macOS, Linux, and Mobile (iOS, Android)
  • Experience implementing security and privacy standards and best practices
  • Experience in managing an IT budget
  • Passionate about working with remote people across an organization
  • Desire to work within a fast-changing business environment
  • Strong problem solving and verbal / written communication skills
  • Degree in a related field (Information Technology, Computer Science) a plus
  • Multi-Lingual (Spanish, Portuguese) a definite plus

Our company culture supports flexible working schedules with an unlimited PTO policy and the opportunity to travel and work remotely with great people. We are also dedicated to your personal and professional development at Cloudbeds. You will have access to over 10,000 courses within LinkedIn Learning when you join our team for your individual growth! If you think you have the skills and passion, we’ll give you the support and opportunity to thrive in your career. If you would like to be considered for the role, we would love to hear from you!

items.content:
Web Project Manager

Aeolidia is growing and we’re looking for a Web Project Manager to join our team! You might be the perfect fit for this full-time, remote position if you think quickly on your feet, have a knack for creative problem solving and revel in bringing a team together to exceed client expectations on each and every project.

Aeolidia is a “one stop shop” design agency that develops brands and creates story-centered ecommerce websites for designers, artisans, and curators that have made it past the startup phase. We pair our custom strategic Shopify websites with analytical insights to continually optimize clients’ sites, resulting in significant growth to their online retail sales.

Our employees are directly responsible for empowering awesome business owners to succeed, and are challenged with meaningful work that improves their particular skills. If this all sounds excellent to you, please keep reading to see if we might be a match to work together!

About Us

Aeolidia is a graphic design and web development agency that has been working with designer and artisan businesses since 2004. We’re the preeminent design team in our creative niche, and we dig deep into strategy based on information we get from each client’s website analytics while also truly understanding the branding part of it. We deliver a gorgeous AND powerful site every time.

A designer or artist’s story should be compelling to customers. We focus on storytelling for brands. This is about each business’s “why” and what makes them unique and irreplaceable to their perfect customers. Since we do business naming, brand vision and voice, brand graphic identity, copywriting, and photography in-house, we have the capability to craft a cohesive story without losing anything along the way.

We are a remote team of overachievers, united in our common goal of taking creative businesses to the next level by paving the way toward substantial increases to online sales.

Now Let’s Talk About You

As the Web Project Manager, you’re a leader, a creative problem solver, and a project manager all in one. You are energized by working with people and keeping projects moving forward. No stranger to delegation, your primary role is to oversee the entire creative process from start to finish. You’re a visionary who can clearly communicate ideas and expectations, as well as facilitate inspired and enthusiastic discussions, all while keeping the team focused and on track with project timelines and deadlines. Your clients’ success is your success – when they win, you win, too!

Here are just a few ways we see you being successful in the Web Project Manager role with Aeolidia:

You’re a Diligent Achiever

You work smartly to deliver a truly top notch experience to your clients. You seek unique solutions, meet each deadline, and just plain get things done. You are a reliable go-getter.

Capable, persistent, and resourceful, you never despair when you hit a roadblock or need to figure out something new. You give it a try, do the research, try try again, ask for help, test it out, succeed, then consider it a learning experience and a new tool in your kit.

You’re a Curious Learner

You know it would be easy to keep doing what has worked in the past, but you also know that technology changes quickly, each business is different, and what works in one case won’t be the best solution in others.

You stay abreast of advancements in design, technology, and each specialty area in your role. You value being at the top of your game, even as things change. You have big ideas, and you’re eager to figure out how to do them.

You’re a Humble Expert

It’s important that each member of our team approaches the client relationship from the mindset of a “doctor”—using their years of expertise and insight to prescribe the right solution. This is in sharp contrast to the “waiter” mentality of taking orders and doing what is asked of us.

You remember that each client knows their business better than you do, and that you have a lot to learn from them. You strike the balance by being authoritative but cooperative and open-minded. You are experienced and your role is to help guide your client down the path to their goal.

You are highly collaborative and function well within a team. You feel comfortable asking for help and being open about what you don’t yet know. And, in turn, eagerly show up and share the special knowledge you do have without being arrogant about it. You also facilitate a team environment where each member feels the same.

You’re a Positive Ally

You anticipate your clients’ needs and concerns, and take an active role in making them feel comfortable with their brand, their technology, and their next steps.

When you see a problem you can solve or help with, you leap to action to make progress toward a solution. You take as much responsibility for client dissatisfaction as you can, knowing that you’re the one guiding the relationship and setting expectations.

You find solutions that are more than just acceptable, but something the client is happy with, and that keeps your relationship with them on a good track.

You’re a Creative Supporter

Your work is meaningful to you. Making a website and getting money is not the satisfying part. You’re in this to watch your clients exceed their goals and feel proud to have contributed.

You care about and believe in your clients’ businesses. You have a personal connection that makes the journeys of designer and artisan businesses meaningful to you.

You understand, you relate to, you value and respect each client and their business. With every step on their project, you are aiming to propel your client to where they want to be next.

A Day in the Life

Now that we’ve covered what it’s like to work with Aeolidia, let’s chat about what you would be doing on an average day. The full-time Web Project Manager will work approximately 40 hours per week guiding the entire process for each of our client projects from start to finish. This includes gathering all needed information from our sales staff, communicating it to the team, creating and balancing realistic schedules between clients, and aligning scope and objectives with to-dos and milestones.

You will be responsible for a Client Care Specialist, a Project Assistant, and a team of designers and developers who each own a piece of the client project. You will be the main point of contact for each client, and your ultimate responsibility will be to guide your team toward reaching the desired outcomes of each project in a timely and cohesive manner, ensuring each client’s complete and total satisfaction and happiness.

Every position with Aeolidia is a remote one, meaning you get to work from wherever you are! This also means that you will be leading a remote team. There are no set schedules or hours. Flexible schedules that fit around your life are what we do best. However, of course we do expect all of our team members to meet their goals and project expectations, so we’ll have weekly meetings to check in on progress, celebrate successes and help clear roadblocks that have a tendency to pop up from time to time. We want to ensure you have every chance to be successful in this role and we’re committed to doing our part to make sure you are.

You’re a Great Fit For Our Team If:

  • You can commit to working 40 hours per week.
  • You have a reliable internet connection which allows you to work from anywhere.
  • You’re an experienced and confident leader; you’ll be overseeing each client project, as well as the entire project team.
  • You’re comfortable delegating, and discussing project goals and outcomes, such as overall vision, goals and design. You know how to set expectations and hold your team accountable.
  • You have a desire to help your team succeed beyond their current roles. You thrive on identifying areas for improvement and opportunities to provide ongoing training that will help them grow.
  • You understand how to give positive feedback and reinforcement, as well as constructive feedback for your team’s efforts and performance.
  • You’re not someone who settles for the status quo. You continuously look for ways to improve and streamline the company’s processes.
  • You love a good challenge and creatively solve problems while thinking quickly on your feet.
  • You are an excellent video, phone, and written communicator, able to be clear and concise while also striking a friendly and approachable tone.
  • You understand and appreciate the financial and timeline implications that each decision will have on a client project, as well as the company.

Bonus Points:

  • You’ve been in a project manager role for at least two years.
  • You hold a bachelor’s degree or higher in a creative or business field.
  • You’ve worked with and supported creative, small businesses.

Fun Perks to Look Forward To:

As part of the Aeolidia team, here are some benefits we will offer you:

  • Flexible work schedule
  • Remote work position
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation, more or less (we’re pretty laid back when it comes to taking time off)
  • Major holidays are paid time off
  • Freedom to take a reasonable number of paid personal days off – we’re family friendly
  • Our virtual office is closed for two weeks during the winter holiday season
  • Participation in a SIMPLE IRA plan with 3% annual company matching
  • Reimbursement for phone and internet plans (based on position)
  • Culture flexibility and freedom in decision making, problem solving, autonomous work environment, and ownership of your position and responsibilities
Salary for this role will be based upon your experience and education.

Aeolidia is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and experiences to be critical to our success and are passionate about creating a welcoming, supportive, and collaborative environment for all employees. All are encouraged to apply as we continue to grow a smart, hard-working, and diverse team who love working together to build something that matters.

How to Apply

  • Apply by midnight Pacific Daylight Time on July 12, 2019. This is your first test. If you can’t meet this deadline, we probably aren’t a great match.
  • Attach a PDF of your cover letter. In your cover letter:
  • Introduce yourself and explain why this position is of interest to you and why you would be a great fit.
  • Let us know what great leadership means to you. Tell us about the best leader you ever had and what made him/her so great.
  • Attach your resume in PDF format. Make sure to include 2 professional references, too.

items.content:
Head of Marketing at Scott's Cheap Flights

Remote

Full-time

Remote (USA timezones)

As the Head of Marketing, you will be leading the team that is directly responsible for achieving our growth objectives. You will be in charge of growing Scott’s Cheap Flights to its full potential by defining the marketing strategy and building and leading the team to successfully implement it.

In the short term, you will:

  • Take on leadership of the marketing team. You’ll hold team meetings and 1-on-1s with your reports.
  • Establish and drive a culture of rapid experimentation and data-informed learning to discover innovative ways to acquire and retain new customers.
  • Establish a consistent brand identity that positions Scott’s Cheap Flights as a member-obsessed market leader across all consumer touch points.
  • Develop and drive our overall marketing strategy, exercising knowledge and mentorship in all channels (paid, organic, public relations, influencers, social, etc.). Partner cross-functionally to assure marketing strategy alignment with the company’s objectives and with team-specific objectives.
  • Establish, analyze, and optimize the overall performance marketing strategy – including Paid Search, Affiliate, Email, Display, Facebook Advertisement, and SEO.
  • Work to efficiently scale paid and organic member acquisition while also expanding into new channels and tactics.
  • Set and manage a budget for the marketing function.
  • Evaluate the team needs and hire strategically to scale the organization.

In the long term, you will:

  • Continually oversee and refine the marketing strategy you’ve built, coaching your reports to create a top tier marketing function with a deep understanding of the member and their journey at its foundation.
  • Analyze marketing data and trends to better position our brand in the competitive landscape, identify key metrics, build dashboards, and deliver actionable insights that substantially improve each stage of the funnel.
  • Monitor performance across all marketing channels and shift resources accordingly to maximize ROI.
  • Participate in our quarterly leadership onsite where our leadership team meets in person for the work week and plans the quarter to follow.

What you bring to the table:

  • You have a proven track record of significantly scaling a growth-stage B2C company, preferably in the travel industry, as the leader of the marketing function.
  • You’re an expert marketer with experience in many digital channels, customer acquisition, engagement, and retention.
  • You have a deep understanding experience with performance marketing, scaling channels with positive unit economics.
  • You have highly developed interpersonal skills and impeccable communication skills.
  • You are an experienced leader with proven experience hiring and mentoring a highly experienced team of marketing experts.
  • You can work well with anyone at the company to accomplish objectives.
  • You’re a person of compassionate integrity and will always keep our members and stakeholders in mind when making decisions.
  • You’re obsessed with data analysis and hypothesis-driven experiments.
  • You have a strong understanding and appreciation of branding, communications, design, and customer segmentation.
  • You’re able to think strategically and provide high-level guidance but aren’t afraid to get in the weeds of any project.
  • You’re willing and enthusiastic about rolling up your sleeves to get stuff done.
  • You’re experienced building and managing a budget, setting spend levels, planning for hiring needs, and communicating projections.

About Scott’s Cheap Flights:

Scott’s Cheap Flights is on a mission to enable people to travel and experience the world.

We’re so much more than crusaders for cheap flights, and our numbers prove it:

  • 1.6 million+: Members to date, growing every day.
  • 100%: Our average year over year revenue growth.
  • $500 million: Amount our deals have helped members save.
  • 263,009: Miles our most prolific member has traveled.
  • 60+: Number of proposals have happened on SCF trips… that we know of.
  • Countless: Memories and stories created through our members’ trips.

If “to travel is to live” resonates with you and you have a proven track record of growing consumer facing startups, we’d love to hear from you!

items.content:
Comp. Systems Valid. Proj. Mgr at Charles River Laboratories

Remote | International

Location: Den Bosch, NB, NL

For nearly 70 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work e perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about.

We are seeking an experienced Deployment Project Manager for our Safety Assessment site located in Europe.

The candidate can work from anywhere in the world.

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the execution of projects.
  • Coordinate validation effort and ensure completeness of projects and consistency between projects.
  • Define and monitor multiple project deliverables and timelines
  • Define deployment strategies in line with business needs and coordinates activities for multi-sites deployment with business leads.
  • Maintain and provide project timelines and statuses in project management tool.
  • Assist the users and project team in the development if the MVP deliverables.
  • Ensure adherence to pertinent regulatory requirements and to departmental policies, practices and procedures [SOPs, safety procedures and biosafety protocols].
  • Performs analyses and validate benefits related to selected projects.
  • Perform all other related duties as assigned.

We are seeking a candidate who:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in validation and project management
  • Has knowledge in Validation and in GXP, an assets.
  • Demonstrate leadership and resourcefulness.

About Safety Assessment
Charles River is committed to helping our partners expedite their preclinical drug development with exceptional safety assessment services, state-of-the-art facilities and expert regulatory guidance. From individual specialty toxicology and IND enabling studies to tailored packages and total laboratory support, our deeply experienced team can design and execute programs that anticipate challenges and avoid roadblocks for a smooth, efficient journey to market. Each year approximately 120 investigational new drug (IND) programs are conducted in our Safety Assessment facilities.

About Charles River
Charles River is an early-stage contract research organization (CRO). We have built upon our foundation of laboratory animal medicine and science to develop a diverse portfolio of discovery and safety assessment services, both Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and non-GLP, to support clients from target identification through preclinical development. Charles River also provides a suite of products and services to support our clients’ clinical laboratory testing needs and manufacturing activities. Utilizing this broad portfolio of products and services enables our clients to create a more flexible drug development model, which reduces their costs, enhances their productivity and effectiveness to increase speed to market.

With over 11,000 employees within 70 facilities in 18 countries around the globe, we are strategically positioned to coordinate worldwide resources and apply multidisciplinary perspectives in resolving our client’s unique challenges. Our client base includes global pharmaceutical companies, biotechnology companies, government agencies and hospitals and academic institutions around the world. And in 2016, revenue increased by 23.3% to $1.68 billion from $1.36 billion in 2015.

At Charles River, we are passionate about our role in improving the quality of people’s lives. Our mission, our excellent science and our strong sense of purpose guide us in all that we do, and we approach each day with the knowledge that our work helps to improve the health and well-being of many across the globe. We have proudly supported the development of ~70% of the drugs approved by the FDA in 2016.

For more information, please visit www.criver.com.

Charles River Laboratories, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disabled/Vet

Description

Edmentum is committed to making it easier for educators to individualize learning for every student through simple technology, high-quality content, actionable data, and customer success. Founded in innovation, Edmentum’s powerful learning solutions blend technology with individual teaching approaches. We are dedicated to being educators’ most trusted partner in creating successful student outcomes everywhere learning occurs. Our commitment is built off the emphasis we place on our core values: passion, people, respect, collaboration, and performance.

The Director of Learning Designer, Math serves as an integral thought leader in the company helping to research and develop Edmentum’s strategy for math content and related products. The Director of Learning Design, Math will collaborate across curriculum, research, product management, and platform teams to lead the planning and learning design for math content and products, supporting the VP Learning Design in presenting strategic plans to the Executive Leadership Team. The position will lead the charge in creating learning design recommendations, both digital and print, that lead the company step by step towards becoming part of the core ecosystem within Tier 1, mainstream classrooms. The vision of the right candidate should be strongly grounded in math current classroom practice, educational research, math core products, math digital products, and an interest in innovation in blended learning that meets the everyday needs of practitioners. Scope of responsibilities may begin K-12 and focus later on K-6 or 6-12 as need for specialization arises.

Here’s what you’ll do:

  • Bear the torch for excellence in math learning design both within the company and support the company in making incremental changes in math content learning design and in associated core product offerings.
  • Demonstrated track record in producing into product educational research in thoughtful and innovative ways.
  • Collaborate with the research department on understanding key math research and introducing new research that enhances Edmentum’s instructional thinking, understanding how both scientifically based research and best practices authorship impact market direction and student outcomes.
  • Ability to achieve results through influence across an organization and collaboration with other departments.
  • Represent the needs of the teacher, the learner, and the administrator in math product discussions.
  • Support the product management team in putting together business plans for products related to math, as necessary.
  • Evaluate partners for excellence against an agreed-upon evaluation rubric and interface with the Manager of Product Partnerships, Learning Design management, and the Executive Leadership Team (ELT) on pursuing advantageous math partnerships.
  • Understand and apply effective classroom practice to high-quality learning design in math and in other areas as assigned.
  • Create Learning Design Briefs and other learning design tools to help guide development of courseware and features.
  • Support the Curriculum team in creating math content by providing guidelines and reviewing key sample content.
  • Partnering with Product Management and Curriculum, evaluate all product ideas for math against academic research, market research (customer surveys, user interviews, purchased surveys), and an in-depth knowledge of current educational practice and the workflow of a teacher’s day.
  • Participate in focus groups, customer interviews, field tests, and site visits that explore direction in the math market and that respond to product concepts and prototypes.
  • Collaborate with Product Management and Software Engineering in understanding the potential for math innovation within our products.
  • Collaborate with Content Development, Research, Product Management, Platform Development, and UI/UX on math learning design initiatives.
  • Interface with and potentially recruit math academic experts and investigate how to implement their feedback.
  • Meet all goals of quality, schedule and budget.
  • Represent Edmentum math learning design within Edmentum and externally with customers and at tradeshows and other events.

Here’s what you’ll need:

  • Experience in math classroom teaching and education preferred.
  • Experience in learning design in math (prototyping, guidelines, scope & sequence creation).
  • Five years’ experience in implementing or design math programs.
  • Has hands-on experience with math core programs and an in-depth knowledge of the competitive field in both core programs and ed tech.
  • Knowledge and experience with UDL and accessibility.
  • Ability to build teams and review others’ work with positive guidance.
  • Proven track record in achieving results through collaboration.
  • Highly creative with strong design skills.
  • Experienced in a variety of innovative instructional modalities and design approaches including game-based learning, close reading, project-based learning, and others.
  • Has strong communication skills (oral, written, and business) to function effectively in a leadership role with internal and external clients and liaise with other national education experts.
  • Ability to tailor technical presentations to different audiences.
  • High levels of collaboration and cross-functional skills and experience.
  • Inspirational, motivational, and results-based leadership skills.

Director of Product

About the position

The Director of Product is a key member of the leadership team at Creative Commons. Reporting to the CEO, they lead the strategy, delivery, and adoption of CC’s major products including CC Search. CC’s vision is “nothing less than realizing the full potential of the Internet — universal access to research and education, full participation in culture — to drive a new era of development, growth, and productivity.” These products will support CC’s strategy to create a vibrant, usable global commons powered by collaboration and gratitude. 

We take a data-driven and user-centered approach to our work. You are someone who's creative, entrepreneurial, and focused on achieving outcomes. You love a big idea, and know how to break it down, evaluate it, and build a plan to make it real. You can see the complexity of the ecosystem, but also worry about the details, especially those that create utility and delight. You know how to use experimentation, iteration, and data-driven research to create product impact and meet strategic goals.

The Director sets strategy, goals and targets for the design and development of CC’s products, including: product vision and roadmap, feature prioritization and implementation, service and revenue model(s), partnerships, growth and user engagement. You will work in close collaboration with the Director of Engineering and her team throughout the process. You will seek opportunities to integrate CC’s tools with partners that could help us meet our strategic goals. 
 

Primary responsibilities

  • Lead and define the product vision, strategy, and implementation of CC’s major products, including our flagship initiative, CC Search:

  • Identify, research, and target key user segments for existing and new products

  • Translate analytics, data and user feedback into actionable product plans

  • Become an industry expert in how content is created, shared, discovered, and re-used online, including a deep knowledge of the competitive product landscape and user needs

  • Work hand-in-hand with engineering, policy, legal and engagement to define and plan specific product initiatives, identify risks and opportunities, and bring strategy to reality

  • Develop products that complement or build upon existing CC products in support of CC’s strategy and goals
  • Conduct usability research to provide ongoing and up-to-date insights into sharing and collaboration with CC tools online and inform CC’s product development, and promote our continued relevance and impact

  • Lead the Tools & Product team along with the General Counsel and Director of Engineering, working closely with them to define team OKRs and coordinate and communicate project plans and dependencies.

  • Orchestrate partnerships that integrate CC’s tools into new and existing platforms and services that extend the reach and utility of the commons to users everywhere.

  • Work in the open, in public documents and repositories, open chat rooms, public wikis and a global community.

    • Qualifications and requirements 
    • Experience leading product management and partnership processes, including:

    • Experience in developing and/or contributing to strategy, leading and managing projects, and working with distributed teams

    • Experience negotiating, motivating, and collaborating with technical teams in executing on product development and shipping features into software

    • Experience negotiating and communicating with diverse stakeholders to create good outcomes for all parties

    • Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and problem-solving skills

    • Superior project management, analysis, planning, and strategy skills

    • Familiarity with human-centered design, user profiling, and insights development to support product strategy and design

    • Sound understanding of the Internet, its technical structures, and business models

    • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills

    • Understanding of basic technical and design concepts related to CC integration and the use of CC tools, including legal, technical, and user experience

    • Ability to work in a distributed team environment, build good working relationships, and produce quality work in a remote work structure

    • Fluent in English; second language competency a plus

    • Familiarity with open licenses and copyright law is a plus, but not required

    Diversity & Inclusion

    We believe that diverse teams build better organizations and better services. Applications from qualified candidates from all backgrounds, including those from under-represented communities, are very welcome. Creative Commons works openly as part of a global community, guided by collaboratively developed codes of conduct and anti-harassment policies.

    Work Environment and Location

    Creative Commons is a fully-distributed organization — we have no central office. This position is available to applicants working in the range of the Eastern to Pacific time zones, in a remote working environment. You must have reasonable mobility for all necessary travel, including meetings with CC partners and organizations, selected conferences, twice-annual all-staff meetings and the Global Summit — this usually means about 6 - 8 trips per year. We provide a subsidy towards high-speed broadband access. Laptop/desktop computer and necessary resources are supplied.

    Salary and Benefits

    Creative Commons is a leading non-profit employer, offering competitive salaries and benefits, including health and wellness plans, annual retirement contributions, and a positive, supportive work environment. We offer competitive salary in the range for this position from $95,000 - $120,000 USD, commensurate with relevant skills, experience, and location.

    How to Apply

    Please email your cover letter and resume as a single PDF to “jobs@creativecommons.org” with the subject heading of “Director of Product / [Last Name].” Phone calls and messages will not be returned.

items.content:
Project Manager at Animal Legal Defense Fund

Remote
  • Animal Legal Defense Fund
  • Reports to: Project Management Program Director
  • Term of Employment: Full-time, Exempt, At Will
  • Location: Cotati, CA; remote applicants will also be considered

Description: The Project Manager provides planning, tracking and management of the Animal Legal Defense Fund’s (ALDF) legal campaigns, enabling our program staff to effectively meet their strategic objectives to advance the field of animal law. The Project Manager fulfils a similar role for ALDF’s cross-functional events, to ensure they are executed on time, on budget and within scope. The Project Manager is an integral part of ALDF’s Project Management Program and works closely with interdepartmental teams to produce successful projects and meet the requirements of key stakeholders.

Essential Responsibilities:

Campaign Project Management (60%)

The Project Manager will be responsible for managing the planning, progress and execution of ALDF’s major campaigns, including:

  • Working with the project stakeholders to develop a project charter, outlining the scope, budget, deliverables, priorities, risk assessment, roles and responsibilities, and protocols for the campaigns
  • Participating in project team selection and clearly communicating expectations to team members and stakeholders
  • Creating a project management and execution plan and maintaining all project documentation
  • Developing a work breakdown structure and estimating the resources required for each task
  • Managing tasks via Project Pro software and providing regular updates to stakeholders regarding progress, milestones, potential delays and risk management plans
  • Being accountable for project team performance and results and acting as a mediator between stakeholders and project team members
  • Effectively managing project scope and dependencies and ensuring any changes to scope are documented and approved
  • Identifying team conflicts and potential project delays and working with the project team to resolve these issues or escalate to the appropriate senior or executive staff
  • Identifying and completing project close-out tasks and leading post mortem meetings to review achievements and recommend improvements for future projects

Event Project Management (35%)

The Project Manager will also be responsible for managing the planning, progress and execution of a portfolio of ALDF’s cross-functional events and receptions, including:

  • Completing all deliverables outlined under the “Campaign Project Management” heading above, as they relate to Event Project Management
  • Ensuring projects remain on time and on budget
  • Participating as a member of the steering committees for assigned events

Program Support (5%)

The Project Manager will also be responsible for the following:

  • Communicating key project details and updates to staff and board members and producing planning memos, as required
  • Providing on-site support for ALDF’s large, annual events, as needed
  • Managing staff and volunteer roles and schedules at events, as needed
  • Other duties as assigned by the Project Management Program Director

Key Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will:

  • Understand and be fully committed to the mission of the Animal Legal Defense Fund
  • Have a minimum of 5 years’ of project management experience
  • Have a proven track record of successful team management, be a skilled negotiator and have the ability to hold team members accountable for their performance
  • Have excellent facilitation, presentation and leadership skills
  • Be able to work independently and be a skilled problem-solver
  • Be able to think strategically and juggle multiple tasks and deadlines while Crotatmaintaining composure
  • Be a skilled writer with strong attention to detail
  • Have excellent planning, organizational, critical thinking and prioritization skills
  • Have excellent interpersonal skills and be able to communicate effectively with colleagues, vendors, and the public
  • Be “computer literate” with working knowledge of common computer applications including Outlook, Word, Excel, Adobe Reader, web browsers, social media platforms, etc.
  • Be experienced using Microsoft Project Pro or similar software
  • Have excellent references relevant to similar positions held
  • Have a valid driver’s license and insurance

In addition to the above qualifications:

  • Experience with event planning is preferred but not required
  • Knowledge of the key people and issues within the field of animal law is preferred

Compensation:

Competitive salary with excellent benefits, including; 100% employer paid comprehensive health care plan, including a flexible spending account, dental benefits, life insurance, generous Paid Time Off, a 401k retirement plan with employer match, up to 5% of annual salary. Maintaining a healthy work/life balance is a core value for the Animal Legal Defense Fund.

Work Environment:

The workplace is a busy, two-story office located in Cotati, California. The workplace is business casual and includes companion animals. Products made from animals or animal parts are prohibited in the office. Remote applicants will also be considered.

items.content:
UENI is a "do-it-for-me" solution that sets us apart from DIY website builders and expensive digital agencies. We take an innovative approach to getting small businesses online by reducing the friction for a business owner to do so. UENI structures the data it collects from a business and creates a website for each business and listings on other high traffic platforms. We thus enable these businesses to complete online for the first time.

_Today we are signing up 2000 businesses everyday and we operate in the UK, Spain, France, the USA, LATAM, India and we are growing our global presence every month._

As Head of Content you will oversee all initiatives around creating the customer website and other online and offline presence, across multiple platforms and formats to drive quality, engagement, retention, and positive customer behavior. Where we refer to *‘Content*’, this refers to *customer content* within the UENI product.
The position collaborates with the departments of product, marketing, customer service, dev and human resources to help define both the content strategy and new content creation, the day to day operations of the content team and the reporting processes for the benefit of other departments.

This opportunity is targeting someone process-minded, highly literate, extremely ambitious and keen to take a lot of responsibility. We are moving fast and our content team is central to our continued successful growth.

*Responsibilities*
Ultimately, your job is to work as an *operations manager*, leading the development of content initiatives to drive growth in the content offered to the various categories of business, the completeness and granularity of categorization and most importantly the daily management of content teams across multiple markets and locations.

This includes:
* Ensuring all content is created according to the company plans of rapid expansion in new markets, consistent in terms of quality, efficiency, and optimized for search and localized user experience for all markets. This is to be done for each market and category.
* Mapping out a content strategy that supports and extends marketing initiatives, both short- and long-term, determining which methods work for the different markets and categories. Continuous involvement of strategy is a must amidst fast-paced growth in different languages.
* Developing a timeline for content creation across business categories, languages and markets, and defining the owners to handle the stages of content creation and quality control.
* Supervising content team, writers, quality control; to be an arbiter of best practices across the content team. .
* Developing standards, systems and best practices (both human and technological) for content creation, venue build, quality control, assistance to Customer Success dept, and adaptation to evolving needs based on UENI’s business strategy
* Integrating content activities within the product and marketing scope of work.
* Conducting tests to gauge content effectiveness. Gathering data and handle analytics (or supervise those who do) and make recommendations based on those results. Working with owners of particular content to revise and measure particular content and marketing goals.
* Leveraging market and CS data to drive plans and adjustments in content team activities.
* Working with the product and technical teams to implement improvements of content team tools to ensure efficiency, cost reduction and daily productivity..
* Conducting periodic competitive audits.
* Ensuring consistent global experience and implement appropriate localization/translation strategies through appointed representative for each language.
* Leading the hiring and supervising of content team in all markets and roles.

*Requirements*
* Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Public Relations, Operations or Business. Project Management or Marketing experience is a plus.
* At least 5 years of experience managing a team and staffing - Either deep experience in digital content creation (websites, social media, directories etc.) or in operations management / project management.
* Technically savvy and hands on: able to jump into company tools to manage processes, review content quality, and ensure that team productivity is adhering to business plan targets
* Multilingual abilities a major plus.

*Skills Required*
The HOC requires a combination of operation management and content management, with the most important aspect being to think “customer first”. In essence, the HOC is the creative and operation manager that must be empathetic toward the pain points of the customer whilst being able to deliver an efficient content creation strategy with the team.

Specific skills required include:
* Proven editorial skills. Outstanding command of the English (or primary customer) language.
* The ability to lead and inspire teams of creative personnel and content creators to achieve the company's stated goals and targets (eg growth in subscriber base, growth in paying customers, reduction in unit costs).
* Leadership skills required to define and manage a set of goals involving diverse contributors in various markets.
* Project management skills to manage venues creation and quality control schedules and deadline. Ability to work under pressure and in a dynamic environment..
* Skill at both long-form content creation and real-time (immediate) content creation.
* Business-minded and driven by data to improve processes, improve efficiency, and increase quality of content to better meet customer needs
* The ability to think like an educator, intuitively understanding what the customers need and how they want their businesses to be represented online.
* A passion for new technology tools (aka, using the tools you preach about) and previous experience in the usage of those tools.
* Excellent negotiator and mediator.
* Incredible people skills and a willingness to work with remote teams and colleagues around the world.
* Basic technical understanding of web publishing, editors, website builders, etc.
* A willingness to embrace change and to adapt strategies on the fly.
* Great reporting skills
* Committed to continually learning the latest platforms, technology tools and solutions through interaction with product department, in particular the CMS.

*What we offer*
* Join an outstanding team culture, working together to help the business achieve its goals and living the UENI values.
* Competitive salary & equity options package
* Holiday increases with each year of service
* Excellent opportunities for personal growth and career development in a people focused organisation.
* More than 300+ discounts with Perkbox
* Employee referral scheme
* Cool office in Hammersmith area with access to gym, fruit, events and plenty of coffee, beer and prosecco

About Trilogy:

Powered by big dreams and small egos, Trilogy is reimagining how skills-based learning can change the face of education. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top universities to create boot camps that prepare highly-motivated students for high-growth careers.

OUR VALUES

We put students first

We put students first because they deserve nothing less – and our university and employer partners expect nothing less. Every aspect of Trilogy’s success depends on this.

We never stop improving

We believe that continuous improvement is the source of innovation. We lend an ear to both our fans and our critics to deliver better programs, better service, better communication, and better value.

We bring a “can do” attitude

We are a team of entrepreneurs who confront challenges head-on and figure things out. We value action, effort, commitment, and learning.

We succeed only as a team

Teamwork is critical to our success, and we place a tremendous value on how we work together in our immediate teams, between our business units, and across the entire company.

We are seeking:

A highly driven and passionate Career Director to provide high-quality coaching to our graduates. We strive to ensure our students have the skills, knowledge, and resilient mindset needed to secure the job or promotion they are seeking upon graduation from our programs. You will be responsible for:

  • ensuring students have access to the resources and support they need in order to become Employer Ready and enter the job market;
  • teaching students how to develop a successful job search strategy;
  • coaching students through their job search;
  • encouraging them to persist in the face of setbacks and disappointments; and
  • listening to, and addressing, and student concerns or challenges during their job search process.

You will coordinate with our Industry Insights and Impact team (an employer-facing team) to match students to employment opportunities.

You will report into a Regional Career Director.

High-level view of who you are:

  • You are excited to engage with students and provide to them daily coaching, support and encouragement throughout the job search process.
  • You utilize high-quality coaching techniques to build relationships, drive results, and build the skills and mindsets of students to foster independence for lifelong success in their careers.
  • You are skilled at identifying areas in which students both excel and need to improve, and can deliver that feedback in ways that feel supportive to students and ignites them to take action.
  • You can build rapport quickly over the phone or video; students feel comfortable opening up to you and respect and listen to your recommendations.
  • You are interested and excited about becoming an expert in the career opportunities and employer needs of the industries our students are entering Web Development, Data Analytics, Cybersecurity, UX/UI, Financial Technology, and Digital Marketing.
  • You have an eye for detail and are dedicated to maintaining accurate records and reports in Salesforce.
  • You know how to analyze data, draw learnings from it, and implement your findings to improve your career coaching.
  • You know how to work successfully in a remote environment.

  • Utilize satisfaction data to understand strengths and opportunities for growth; implement learnings to increase satisfaction
