Job Description:
The Veteran’s Health group at Leidos has an opening for an ITIL Service Asset and Configuration Management Program Manager position. The role can be worked remote from your home office within the United States. This role will be in support of the Veterans Affairs Service Operations Configuration Management team. Program Manager must have experience with diverse IT projects both large and small. Must be able to manage a portfolio of projects. Must be well versed in full systems development life cycle, enterprise wide network engineering, strategic information planning, business process reengineering, structure and management practices. Must be able to identify and mitigate risks to the program. Must be able to manage to cost, schedule and performance.

The Program Manager shall provide change, release and configuration support at the ITIL program office level and support the ITIL functions of Change Management, Release Management, Build Management and Configuration management, as they are executed throughout the ITOPS. These ITIL management disciplines ensure that all components of product releases and infrastructure changes are organized and deployed in a controlled manner enabling a repeatable process. The Program Manager shall review, analyze and standardize release and deployment processes and audit those processes as well. The Contractor shall support the design and implementation of formal procedures, including checks and balances throughout the process. The Program Manager shall identify and mitigate risk to ensure the integrity and recoverability of the production environment and ensure the currency, accuracy, and completeness of the CMDB for all business and technical data elements for IT Operations applications.

Primary Responsibilities
This resource will support our efforts in aligning Change, Release and Configuration Management through the enterprise and they will assist with this increased workload. They will support the Configuration Management team with establishing organizational timelines, policy and procedures to meet organizational goals. The Resource will assist with leading SharePoint Project Management, Timelines and documentation efforts.

Our customer base is loyal and passionate (as you will see from our online reviews) and, and we are expanding our product team to deliver the next level of customer delighting products and features.

*The Role*
We’ve got a growing but neglected user base, and we’re looking for a CRM champion to own our outbound audience marketing channel with best in class content planning, creation and campaign execution, activating, engaging, converting and delighting Awaymo account holders at all touch points throughout the customer life cycle.

*You’ll be responsible for defining our CRM strategy from top to bottom, including:*
* Define the CRM Strategy and create a clear implementation plan covering tools, methods and content
* Plan and manage CRM calendar and campaign review process
* Deliver targeted email campaigns, direct mail drops, and other touch points
* Create highly engaging email copy that is personalised to the target audience
* Use data and analytics to inform the CRM & Loyalty strategy
* Follow a strategic approach to segmentation by using a mix of personal and behavioural data
* Optimise performance of automated campaigns through testing and learning initiatives to ensure our metrics remain at or above target
* Drive continual revenue growth from our customer database
* Steer the customer experience and optimisation of our direct communications, to ensure we provide a user-centric, engaging experience for our customers, whilst meeting goals and KPIs
* Implement a clear and concise measurement plan and present to stakeholders regularly with accurate KPIs

*What You’ll Need:*
* Significant experience in a CRM role, implementation change and creating effective CRM plans
* Experience in implementing new software/tools/systems/processes
* Excellent analysis and reporting skills with a clear focus on results
* Experience in developing new targeted initiatives to drive customer behaviour change
* Knowledge of how to talk to the customer across the full customer journey in key brand media channels
* Knowledge and experience with marketing automation and data driven marketing
* Positive attitude, able to work under pressure and within a moving framework
* Be a self-starter and take control of your own work-flow
* Strong understanding of psychology and human behaviour
* Love to solve problems and be challenged
* To be a constant learner. Always growing - both personally and with the team
* Excellent copywriting, communication and presentation skills
* Strong analytical skills and an interest in data
* Fluent in spoken and written English

*Desired:*
* Some experience in programming and ability to code simple HTML emails
* At least 2 years of experience working in fast-paced startup environment
* Travel or fintech experience

*What we offer*
* High-impact role at an industry disrupter
* Casual dress
* Free beer/cider/tea/coffee/water/etc
* Ping pong and air hockey tables
* Team nights out
* Fantastic London location with private offices in WeWork

Trint solves the pain point of manual transcription by applying AI so users can easily and efficiently extract value from their recordings. Our browser-based platform converts any audio or video to text in just minutes. We’re a productivity platform for collaborative media and content analysis.

Trint’s bold aspirations are focussed on leading innovation and growth in the emerging voice economy and unlocking value from the spoken word. Google’s Digital News Innovation Fund has twice awarded us large grants to further Trint’s innovation in audio/video content management. Trint is reshaping voice-driven value creation by integrating into existing enterprise workflows in big verticals that include media, research and video production.

Customers include: The Associated Press, The New York Times, ESPN, Vice News, The Washington Post, Thomson Reuters, Fox Sports, Der Spiegel, Deutsche Welle, Yale University, Nike and AirBnb.

At Trint we’re proud of the culture we’ve built over the last 4.5 years: we’re passionate about our product; we’re team players; we care about our users. The company is a team of 45: 38 in our London HQ and 7 in our North American sales office in Toronto. We’ve just closed a £3.5M Series A, so we’re well positioned to reach for the sky.

Where do you fit in?
We’re building a Marketing team fueled by inspiration, imagination, grit and a deep understanding of SaaS behaviours. We love that our brand has become a small cult and that we have legions of true Trintlovers, but we know we need to do better to make the most of this enviable position. We’re searching for a marketing leader who can tap into our magical product, our compelling backstory, our really positive culture and a huge market opportunity.

Role
Trint is seeking a Head of Marketing who’s both a “demand-gen” SaaS expert and a master of scale-up brand storytelling. You’ll drive inbound/outbound to directly generate revenue and contribute to sales bookings. You’ll also accelerate our brand adoption by amplifying top-of-funnel acquisition, creating a bond with users over the lifetime of the customer journey. Users love our product and journalists love our story. You’ll own our strategy for building brand profile as we seek to make “Let’s Trint it” part of the lexicon.

You’ll be a key player in our Leadership Team and an important contributor to the company’s overall strategy. You’ll also manage and grow a team of marketing professionals. Most importantly, you’re in a position to craft the marketing discipline at Trint and make it your own!

Responsibilities
CUSTOMER ACQUISITION - Design the overall Demand Generation strategy, including inbound lead acquisition across webinars, websites/SEO, content, SEM/ PPC, social, remarketing, events, email and offline channels
Execute and measure marketing programs across the enterprise buying cycle to generate new inquiries, qualify existing prospects, drive sales meetings and grow the sales pipeline
Accelerate attribution modelling for the non-enterprise ecommerce engine

OUR BRAND - Build a strong brand presence in our markets with effective company and product storytelling; execute earned media, influencer, evangelist and partner campaigns

PRODUCT MARKETING - Oversee our product marketing strategy as we constantly release new features and innovations

TARGET MARKETS - Refine market segments by geo and vertical and target clients that will have the highest yield. Curate a deep understanding of those targets, including their needs, purchase process and how they consume communications to ensure the most effective outreach

CAMPAIGNS - Coordinate with Sales and Customer Success teams to prioritise and develop integrated campaigns, determine best channels for each product/campaign/piece of content

NURTURE - Execute nurture strategies that navigate the customer journey and their digital space for both Enterprise and prosumer customers

TESTING - Conduct A/B tests across channels to continuously optimise campaign and channel performance

LEADERSHIP - Manage marketing operations including the marketing budget, reporting and dashboards to demonstrate ROI
Lead a team of marketing professionals. Provide coaching and accelerate performance and development.

ANALYTICS - Ability to work closely with a data analytics function to storytell internally with data and report to the business how progress is being achieved / challenges overcome

WEBSITE - Manage trint.com, including website development and updates, oversee the design and content of landing pages, integration with CRM and marketing automation. Manage website conversion, testing and optimization initiatives leveraging agencies

Required skills

- 5+ years in a leadership role with experience leading demand generation teams in a SaaS environment
- Experience in building a scale-up brand that transforms a passionate user community into a brand that resonates across target segments
- Strong storytelling and excellent writing skills that shape our messaging and our brand
- Deep experience with marketing automation and data tooling including Hubspot, Mixpanel, Intercom, Google Analytics and others
- Proven experience scaling demand generation programs (e.g. outbound marketing, events, lead nurturing, account based marketing etc.)
- Demonstrated, significant and measurable results (acquisition, CAC, LTV) in previous roles
- Understanding of and experience in executing B2B buyer journeys and developing collateral or assets that advance and accelerate the sales cycle
- Excellent budget experience
- Able to juggle both short and long-term priorities along with daily demands of project management
- Strong emotional EQ helping to inspire, console and generate excitement in your team and across the business
- An understanding of media production workflows for audio, video and text content is a big asset

Benefits:

Share Option Scheme
Team Events & Beer Fridays
A relaxed & sociable office environment
Gym Subsidy
Office Snacks
Flexible working & working from home
Cycle to Work Scheme
In-house Yoga
25 Day Holidays Allowance + Bank Holidays
Critical Illness Cover
Income Protection Insurance
Workplace Pension Scheme
And more to come! We're on the look-out for new and exciting perks that help us on our journey to becoming an employer of choice, so watch this space!

Platform Migration Project Manager, Tech Team (Contractor)

MoveOn.org Civic Action and MoveOn.org Political Action

Request for Proposals

Project Title: Platform Migration Project Manager, Tech Team

Proposals accepted on a rolling basis until: Friday, July 5, 2019

Project Description: The MoveOn tech team builds, customizes, and integrates innovative technology that enables staff to lead, participate in, and win campaigns for progressive change. For more than 20 years, the MoveOn family of organizations has used online tools to lower the barriers to participation in our democracy. MoveOn web properties handle millions of hits a month, and MoveOn has terabytes of data that drive ambitious analytics, fundraising, and engagement programs. At MoveOn, making decisions with data is a core part of how all work gets done. Like many nonprofit tech teams, we're a small, scrappy team, wear many hats, and work across the software stack.

The MoveOn tech and petition platform teams are working on a project to migrate our legacy in-house petition system to a new platform. Because of the significant complexity involved in any system migration, we need a project manager to help us keep track of deliverables, dates, tasks, and work sequencing for the tech team.

Request for Proposal:MoveOn is seeking a project manager to embed with and work alongside the 5 person tech team, 3 person analytics team, and 4 person petition platform team. The project manager will create and manage a centralized list of incoming requests and tasks assigned to the tech team, create and manage a calendar of task deadlines, work closely with the CTO and petition platform migration team lead to triage incoming tasks, and notify task owners of upcoming deadlines. Task management will happen in a combination of Asana and Github.

Scope of Work:

  • Familiarize yourself with the current and developing plans for the petition platform migration project

  • Meet weekly with the CTO and petition platform migration team lead to assess and help plan out upcoming work

  • Research and compile information as-needed to ensure all tasks are clearly defined, specific, and implementable

  • Capture technical work to do in a combination of Asana and Github tasks, including task descriptions of what needs to be done, why, how this work fits into the larger migration project, and a definition of “done”.

  • Attend tech team sprint planning meetings to assign out tasks to the tech team

  • Track task sequencing with stakeholders to make sure the right work is being done in the right order

  • Track task completion with the tech team to make sure everyone knows what they should be working on, and that nobody is blocked

  • Work with petition platform migration lead to set up regular team meetings, including preparing agendas and handling all follow up

  • Produce and send out weekly status updates to stakeholders

Total capacity: candidate would have at least 10hrs / week availability from contract start date through the end of August 2019, with a possibility of extension. A Master Services Agreement can be put in place with an hourly rate, hours varying from 10-40 hours a week as candidate is available, and as needs for new project work arise. Candidate should be able to be online for at least 5 hours during US EST during week days, with hours negotiated with the tech team, at least 3 days a week. Invoicing and payment will be twice a month.

Trial period: this consulting position would start with an initial 2 week contract focusing on onboarding and proposing processes for task tracking systems. If both sides are in agreement about candidate and project fit, the contract would be extended through August 2019. At the end of August 2019, another checkpoint will occur, with option to extend the role through the end of 2019.

Organization Overview:

MoveOn is a community of millions of Americans from all walks of life who use innovative technology to lead, participate in, and win campaigns for progressive change and push back against right-wing policies while pursuing economic, racial, and social justice. For more than 20 years, the MoveOn family of organizations has used online tools to lower the barriers to participation in our democracy. MoveOn has a particularly important role to play in the Trump era. We are working to defeat Donald Trump and the GOP in 2020 by building a powerful, multiracial, and economic populist movement that will give voters something to vote for, not just against—and we're also working to defend communities that are on the front lines of Trump and GOP attacks, including immigrants, people of color, the LGBTQ community, and women.  

In preparing for the opportunities and challenges ahead of us in 2018, MoveOn is investing deeply in building and scaling our technology stack.

Budget:

MoveOn will consider all proposals.

Proposal Requirements:

Background: Name, title and contact information of primary contact. A brief description of prior project management work or roles.

Approach:

Please describe:

  • Your strategies for task sequencing, tracking, and management

  • Your strategies for getting up to speed on new projects with many stakeholders

  • Your strategy for working with both technical and nontechnical stakeholders, and working in an all-remote, Slack-centric working environment.

Experience: Proposals should include a description of relevant experience, including seeing projects through to completion.

Schedule and Timeline: Please outline a high level timeline for your availability, broken down into hours / week through the end of August 2019.
 

Cost: Include an estimate for hourly rate and total available hours in your proposal.

Submission: Submit to proposals@moveon.org and put "Platform Migration Project Manager, Tech Team" in the subject line.

Most-Favorable Terms

● MoveOn reserves the right to make an award without further discussion of the proposal submitted. Therefore, the proposal should be submitted initially on the most favorable terms that the vendor could propose. There will be no best-and-final-offer procedure. MoveOn does reserve the right to contact a vendor for clarification of its proposal.

● The vendor should be prepared to accept this request for proposal for incorporation into a contract resulting from this request for proposal. Contract negotiations may incorporate some of or the vendor’s entire proposal. It is understood that the proposal will become a part of the official procurement file on this matter without obligation to MoveOn.

No Obligation to Contract

This request for proposal does not obligate MoveOn to contract for services specified herein.

Rejection of Proposals

MoveOn reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to reject any and all proposals received without penalty and not to issue a contract as a result of this request for proposal.

Nondiscrimination

The vendor will adopt a policy stating that the vendor, in employment, recruitment, selection, compensation, benefits, promotion, demotion, layoff, termination, and all other terms and conditions of employment, will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, age, sex, national origin, ethnic identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, marital status, economic status, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected basis.

items.title: Director of Marketing
items.content:
Director of Marketing at Sandbox VR

Remote | International

REMOTE

EXECUTIVE – MARKETING

FULL TIME

Who are we?

We’re Sandbox VR, and we’re the most advanced virtual reality experience in the world. Inside our rooms, we take you on thrilling adventures and transform you into new characters. Our experience is like the movies, except you’re actually with your friends inside the movie.

Our team is comprised of successful start-up veterans with deep experience in VR, gaming, technology and hospitality. We’re funded by leading global tech investors including Andreessen Horowitz and Alibaba.

Since we launched in 2017, we’re now live in 6 locations and 4 countries around the world (4.5 stars on Yelp, and the #1 Activity in Hong Kong and Singapore on TripAdvisor), and we’re quickly expanding.

What will you be doing?

You’ll be leading marketing for our global brand and retail locations around the world. You and your team will be responsible for making sure our retail locations have overwhelming demand and our brand is beloved by all guests. You’ll be doing everything from managing our social channels, to defining our email lifecycle content, to owning our paid acquisition efforts.

Specifically in this role, you’ll be responsible for:

Our Brand Voice:

As a new company in a bleeding edge market, we must build a unique and consistent brand. You and your team will be the primary owners of this brand, and will need to make sure we deliver our brand promise with high quality and consistency across all our channels – from social, to email, to even out of home billboards. You should be a strong writer and communicator able to roll up your sleeves in the early days to make sure we consistently communicate our message across channels.

Growth and Content Marketing:

You’ll use our owned channels (email, social, web) to define lifecycle marketing campaigns to make our guests experience better, smoother, and increase anticipation. You’ll also create compelling content for our existing guests across channels to entice them to visit again, and stay updated with everything new in our retail locations. Success means significant, measurable impact of content and growth marketing against bookings and retention.

Paid Marketing:

You’ll be responsible for setting our guest acquisition strategy through paid efforts both online and offline. You may also work with local press and influencers to launch new retail locations and to drive further demand to our existing locations. Success means our stores are overflowing with demand with efficient marketing spend.

Who are we looking for?

We’re looking for someone who has at least 6+ years of experience in growth marketing and demand generation across a variety of channels, and have an exceptionally strong portfolio of marketing work.

  • You should have a quantitative bent – you should know how to measure impact of the campaigns that your team ships and be proactive in doing so.
  • You should have experience shepherding a consistent, high quality brand experience across digital and physical touchpoints.
  • You should be a strong writer yourself and be an exceptional editor for other writers that you work with.

How can you really impress us?

  • If you’ve been a founder in the past, we’d love to hear about it, especially if you’ve failed. Our team is highly entrepreneurial and the majority of us have been founders before (and most of us have failed).
  • If you’re super passionate about VR, we’d love to hear about it. How’d you get into it? What disappointed you? VR is not in a good spot today, but we’re all true believers and we believe we will help make it happen.
  • A huge bonus for this role in particular would be sending us writing samples that you’re especially proud of.

items.content:
Project Manager - Development

You’re a fun, hardworking Project Manager who’s committed to using your gifts to making the world a better place.

You thrive in a fast-paced, creative environment. You’re excited to use your technical know-how and solutions-oriented mindset to see development projects through from ideation to implementation.

This position is responsible for overseeing all development projects. You’ll work closely with the Marketing Operations Manager and the Creative Project Manager to iterate on existing projects and implement new ones. This includes creating scopes for the development team, handling Q/A checks on working projects, managing bugs and technical issues as reported by our team, and overseeing the technical success of product launches.

As a part of our team, you’ll wear many hats and have the opportunity to help grow and shape the future of our company. The only limit is your drive, commitment and imagination.

Reading this makes you say, “WOW — that’s ME!”:

  • You’re an effective, clear communicator in all formats

  • You have a curious, efficient, and solution-oriented mindset

  • You’re practically always on time (or early) and strive to deliver ahead of deadlines

  • You have excellent project management skills and are able to juggle multiple projects while communicating honestly about your timelines, challenges and questions

  • You do great work autonomously and as part of a highly collaborative team (you’ll need to do both here!)

  • When a mission-critical project happens, you work until the job gets done

  • You do whatever it takes and the phrase “That’s not my job” is not a part of your vocabulary

  • You’re hyper focused on getting the details right — you don’t do sloppy work or let little things slip through the cracks

  • You’re on top of the latest and greatest in techniques and technologies

In an ideal world, you have:

  • 2+ years of project management experience

  • A background in web technology

  • A technical understanding of websites and web applications. While you may not be able to write the code yourself, you understand how it functions and how to communicate what may be broken.

  • The ability to explain web technologies to those who may not understand it, but need to use it every day

  • Strong ideation skills and are able to execute a project from start to finish independently

This position is not for you if:

  • You have personal drama

  • You don’t really commit wholeheartedly to anything

  • You think self-help is weird

  • You have no sense of humor

  • You don’t live and work in the continental United States

The nitty gritty

  • We’re open to this being a full time employee or freelance position

  • Full time employees get 6 weeks paid vacation, 401K, health/dental insurance, inspiration days, paid holidays, and competitive pay

  • Your location isn’t as important as your attitude and talent, but it’s required that you live and work in the continental United States

  • This is a virtual position working with our virtual team

Marie Forleo International is an equal opportunity employer.

items.title: Director of Project Management
items.content:
Director of Project Management at Bishop Fox

Remote

Location: All

We are the trusted advisors to the world’s leading businesses, governments, and organizations helping to secure their networks, data, and applications. Whether they’re looking to safeguard their critical infrastructure or credit cards; social media or mobile games; flight navigation systems or frozen waffle factories we’re right there, advising every bit of the way.

We are hiring a director of our Project Management Office (PMO) to ensure that both our internal project management team and client-facing engagement management team deliver on every project with the level of finesse that matches our reputation.

What You’ll Do

As the Director of PMO, you will be scaling and maturing a PMO at a high growth, fast-paced technology company. This is an undertaking which you have already executed on at multiple firms. In this role, you will work closely with the VP of consulting, sales team, and customer success manager to enable the engagement managers to provide the highest degree of execution and customer service. This role will be directly responsible for the performance, development, and delivery of the PMO, including metrics such as customer satisfaction through NPS score, on-time, on-budget, and profitable projects. You will enable our PMO to run as a well-oiled machine, operating consistently and seamlessly, providing our clients and internal teams with a combination of structure and flexibility.

Responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

  • Defining the vision and plan for PMO success
  • Determining opportunities to automate processes and functions
  • Building positive and productive relationships between PMO and sales, service delivery, and support teams
  • Proactively reporting critical PMO data to VP of customer success, data analytics, and various stakeholders
  • Performing resource capacity planning and resource allocation for the engagement managers
  • Incorporating experience and best practices to mentor and develop the team
  • Developing team OKRs to align with customer success department goals
  • Serving as a point of escalation for engagement concerns

Why Bishop Fox

We believe that what we do makes an impact, and our culture reflects it in the best possible way. Every one of us plays a role in our success. We value our time and our well-being, we love what we do, and we look out for one another. Bishop Fox offers competitive salaries, flexible schedules, travel opportunities, and a one-of-a-kind environment. For the right candidate, it will feel like a second home.

Your Education and Experience

In addition to the above, the following is a list of skills and traits that describe you. If you have most of these, we’d like to speak with you.

Work Experience and Education

  • 15+ years running project(s) in IT / consulting services
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification required
  • Bachelor’s Degree in related field or equivalent relevant professional experience
  • Industry experience in cybersecurity and/or offensive security preferred

Technical Skills

  • Proven track record of successfully growing and maturing a PMO team in a high-growth organization
  • Subject matter expert in formalized/rigorous project management methodology
  • Strong analytical skills with the demonstrated ability to evaluate business opportunities in the context of a larger organization

Soft Skills

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Readily adaptable to changing market and organizational requirements
  • Aptitude for championing quality throughout the organization
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines while maintaining a positive attitude and providing exemplary customer service
  • Excellent decision-making skills
  • Team player mindset
  • Highest standards of accuracy, precision, and organization
  • Impeccable problem-solving skills

We are accepting applicants from across the country, preference given to applicants located near one of our offices (Phoenix, San Francisco, New York, Atlanta).

Interested? Drop us a line today!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.

Apply for job

RELAYTO is looking for a UK-based design leader (remote or at London office) to work directly with our founders and lead a small design team – with the potential to progress into an executive-level Chief Design Officer.

We are open to working together either on a permanent or freelance basis.

*1/ WHAT IS RELAYTO?*

RELAYTO helps sales & marketers to turn documents into interactive presentations & web pages with instant branding, analytics & more. It’s a $30B opportunity to re-think B2B content for the modern age.

RELAYTO is a fast-growing and award-winning (we are a Top100 European private company as awarded by Red Herring) tech startup that already worked with world-class enterprise clients such as Accenture, Salesforce, Mercedes Benz and PwC-Startupbootcamp.

We are proud graduates of TechStars and Accenture’ Fintech Innovation Lab, Salesforce Accelerate and currently participating in the Alchemist Accelerator in San Francisco (the role is still in London).

Curious to find out more? Check out rla.to/pitch


*2/ FOUNDERS & ADVISORS*

Alex Shevelenko - CEO
* Cloud Pioneer: pre-IPO at SuccessFactors through to exit to SAP for $3.4B. Stanford MBA, ex-Salesforce and Microsoft (helped launch Office 95).
* Consulting: only MBA student awarded by Foundation for Excellence in Management Consulting & Association of Management Consulting Firms in recognition of client work at Mercer Management Consulting / Oliver Wyman
* Creative + Science: contributed to 50 creative/digital awards without “creative/design training” by developing Ideas Science ™ method that leverages behavioral and neuroscience research


Nikita Korotaev - CTO
* Founded & built from scratch Lectrio, the next-generation online learning environment.
* Scaled SaaS business to 20+ geographies
* Recognized as “Exceptional Talent” by Tech City UK and won a Russian Presidential Award for top computer science students.


Advisors:

We have built a network of world-class Silicon Valley advisors:

* Aaron Au – Co-Founder/CTO of SuccessFactors (now CTO of SAP and head of SAP collaboration business)
* Hiroki Asai, Apple GVP Marketing, who for 15 years lead all comms and 1000-person creative team working directly with Steve Jobs
* Steve King, ex CEO of DocuSign and current Executive Chairman of Nuxeo



*3/ DAY TO DAY ROLE*

At RELAYTO, you would be a part of a small international team (London, Silicon Valley & Paris), operating primarily via Slack & Asana, and working directly with the Founders.

While every day in a startup is different, you can expect these responsibilities:

✓ Being the champion of our users and clients
✓ Creating high-end templates in PPT / Photoshop for upload onto the RELAYTO Platform
✓ Understanding client specifications and creating interactive experiences using the R/ Toolkit
✓ Designing infographics and marketing material to help explain the RELAYTO value proposition
✓ Leading and mentoring a team of junior designers
✓ Demonstrating the product and use cases/examples in a client environment
✓ Working with our Product Team to shape the future of the end-user experience



*4/ WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?*

In general, the person most likely to succeed in this role will possess:

✓ A high level of visual aesthetics, including advanced typographical, design and layout skills.
✓ A portfolio that demonstrates innovative designs
✓ An expert understanding of design theory and structure i.e. type, colour, formatting, semiotics, information design and digital design.
✓ Prior design agency experience or equivalent
✓ A strong commercial understanding that will enable you to “put yourself in the clients shoes”.


Key technical skills (you will be tested on these):

✓ PowerPoint / Google Slides
✓ Adobe Illustrator
✓ Adobe Photoshop
✓ Adobe Indesign


Nice to have skills for extra brownie points:

* Web Design/CSS
* Adobe After Effects
* Sketch

Admin points

✓ Permission to work either in the UK or proven ability to work remotely
✓ Upper-Intermediate English Level



*5/ WHAT DO I GET?*

We are a location-free startup, currently spanning London, San Francisco & Paris. We encourage flexibility and opportunity for working virtually or in physical teams, depending on your preference.

Once you join, these come in a package:

* Competitive remuneration + equity
* Remote work via Slack, Asana & Zoom
* Work directly with the CEO, CTO & be part of the founding team.
* Room to grow within a startup that has only scratched the surface of its vast potential
* Professional guidance from an advisory board that includes Hiroki Asai, Apple’s former GVP Marketing, Communications & all-things-creative.
* Being a part of the Accenture, PwC, Salesforce and Alchemist accelerator networks
* Ability to have a direct impact on client projects that matter (we are currently in discussion with a multinational life science company to help market its life-saving drugs)
* Exciting product challenges, in both architecture, product management and user experience.
* A jerk-free culture defined by trust, respect, and empathy.
* Optional personal development in product marketing & general business skills

About us

Disperse is a VC-backed artificial intelligence construction startup focused on improving on-site productivity with the help of computer vision. Our goal is to ultimately re-imagine the way building projects are planned, delivered and operated.

We're currently working on some of the largest building projects in London (e.g. Renzo Piano’s Shard Place, Wood Wharf) and have grown from 5 to 35 people over the past year. We have ambitions to expand significantly, which means that we are looking for passionate and enthusiastic talent to join the team.

We move at a high speed, and will provide you with immense opportunities for initiative, creativity and leadership. Our proudly diverse, international team is based in London, Sarajevo and Yerevan, and has a wealth of experience from construction management to computer vision and robotics.

Your role

We are looking for a hardworking and organised Project Coordinator to lead our ever-growing number of projects and to help navigate us through our expansion. You will be responsible for coordinating needs between our clients and our project teams, and for ensuring that everything we do is streamlined, and operates like a well-oiled machine.

This role places you right in the middle of our project delivery as a critical interface between each of our teams and our clients. You will gain exposure to all areas of the business and will experience firsthand what it takes to scale up an AI startup.

Throughout your time at Disperse, you will receive regular mentoring from different members of the team to make your experience at Disperse the best it can be.

Some of the work that you might be doing includes:

Overseeing project timelines, assuring required resources to successfully meet implied deadlines.
Liaising with clients to make sure the required information is communicated to the team swiftly and that new projects are onboarded at the desired pace.
Monitoring progress across all projects and solving potential issues.
Planning employees’ timelines across the projects according to weekly needs, and leading and organising the equipment inventory.
Taking part in the planning and preparation of our product launches.
Contributing to the development and evolution of our processes and ways of working.
Our culture
Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. We always look out for each other, no matter what. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.

REQUIREMENTS
You should apply if:

You thrive on helping your team, colleagues and clients achieve their objectives.
You have excellent time management and organisational skills.
You're analytical and structured with a keen attention to detail.
You're an excellent written and verbal communicator with a knack for always finding the right tone.
Have a solid ability to develop effective written materials such as client documentation and process guidelines.
You're eligible to work in the UK. No visa sponsorship is available for this position.

BENEFITS

Salary of £30,000-£32,000 plus potential equity compensation upon fit.
Friendly, open and transparent culture.
You'll get to join a passionate startup with proven traction on its scaling journey.
Flexible working hours / ability to work from home.
Regular mentoring and feedback.
Awesome startup office in Central London, Fitzrovia.
25 days’ holiday plus all bank holidays.
Free coffee.
Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Sarajevo... Where next?)

The process

The interview process will involve:

A review of your application;
A 15-minute chat where we both can learn more about each other;
Homework assignment for us to get a sense of how you tackle problems;
Two rounds of on-site technical and cultural chats with the team. If you are not currently based in London, we would be happy to speak with you over video chat;
Final round to iron out any remaining questions you may have.
This process should take around two weeks, depending on diaries.

Vice President of Engineering at Daily Kos

Remote

LOCATION: Oakland, CA preferred, but remote considered for right candidate

Daily Kos is the nation’s largest liberal online political community, news organization, and activism hub. Powered by millions of dedicated activists, we’re transforming media and organizing by empowering regular Americans to reshape politics.

We are seeking an experienced VP of Engineering to manage and scale our growing engineering team. This person will set and achieve our engineering strategy and goals by working closely with leadership and the product team to deliver what’s next for Daily Kos, ensure the maintenance and performance of the existing systems and features, grow the engineering team and demonstrate technical leadership. This person should expect to consistently, collaboratively and efficiently deliver engineering excellence.

Daily Kos is an exciting workplace! Our site is used by hundreds of thousands of people a day who care deeply about progressive politics and are working to affect real political change. We provide an extensive feature set that extends from blogging to activism and beyond, built on top of a modern tool chain that includes Rails, React, Varnish, Nginx, RDS/MySQL, Haskell, Nix, ElasticSearch, and AWS. We have an energized team of great people with diverse backgrounds and skill sets. If you’re interested in a position that offers more than just a technical challenge, we’d love to hear from you.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Execution of dynamic management, leadership, and strategic vision for growing engineering team.
  • Build and inspire a diverse world-class engineering team that delivers with quality and efficiency.
  • Establish key internal relationships and cross-functional teams to deliver creative, high-performing, secure and sustainable solutions.
  • Manage architecture to produce scalable product in a steadily growing political media organization.
  • Ensure attitude of constant vigilance around security of software that is critical to an organization with a highly visible public presence.
  • Develop and implement top-notch product road-map and development processes.

EXPERIENCE:

  • Successfully recruiting, managing, and retaining remote staff including contractors.
  • Maintaining and/or replacing legacy software.
  • Building on top of Rails and React is highly desirable.
  • Ideally, dealing ad networks from the publisher side, doing any or all of the following: creating ads; managing the integration of ad networks; advertising client relations; ad trafficking; and ad inventory creation.
  • Leading, mentoring, motivating, and developing diverse teams.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Leader with a demonstrated track record building and scaling technical teams to deliver compelling experiences for large audiences across multiple channels and platforms.
  • Influencer with the capacity to bridge existing solutions with new and innovative software architecture and features.
  • Strategic thinker with the ability to identify complex issues early and address them systematically before they become problematic.
  • Team leader who believes transparency, collaboration, and inclusiveness can be key to scaling.
  • Engineering authority who understands that quality is paramount, but speed is critical to keep pace with American politics and liberal activists.
  • Superb communicator, able to bring alignment to teams with individuals at all levels.

SALARY RANGE: $180,000 – $200,000

BENEFITS:

This position is a 40 hour/week, full-time exempt position and reports to the Chief Technical Officer. Candidates must be legally eligible to work in the United States. The position offers a flexible work environment, the ability to work remotely or from home, competitive salary, excellent benefits including: full medical, dental and vision benefits, optional 401K with a company match, professional development stipend, a generous vacation package, as well as employer-paid maternity/family leave. Our organizational commitment to personal growth and work-life balance reduces churn and encourages a very rewarding long term position.

At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences, and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective activists, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity workplace. We have a team of amazing people with different backgrounds and talents that are energized by the day’s news events, and people united by common cause. We’re a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees.

Women, people of color, and LGBTQIA individuals strongly encouraged to apply.

items.content:
Director of Sales

Who We Are & What We Do 

Truvani is a health and wellness brand that has one clear mission: create products people use in their daily lives with CLEAN ingredients.
Many companies claim it. We actually mean it.

Our co-founder Vani Hari, better known as The Food Babe, started out as an activist who wanted to hold big companies accountable for what they put into their products. And she made tremendous progress with the help of her online following dubbed "The Food Babe Army."

But after years of fighting, she realized that the only way to make a truly lasting change in the food system is to compete with these big companies head-to-head.

So, she launched Truvani. We are a fast paced, high-growth health and wellness company that is looking to work with talented, ambitious people who want to create the best health and wellness products.

About The Position

Truvani is looking for a Director of Sales to join our team. You’ll be responsible for expanding distribution in the US, aligned with the national sales strategy. By delivering best in class new product launches, sales planning and customer engagement, you will be playing a vital role in the growth of Truvani.

Our Ideal Candidate

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing or related field
  • Experience in the Grocery and Natural Channels (including but not limited to: Hannaford, Earth Fare, Giant Eagle Safeway) with CPG selling background in dry grocery
  • Established relationships and demonstrated success working with key retail accounts along with the leading brokers and distributors (KeHE, UNFI, DPI) servicing these channels
  • Strong planning and organizational skills along with excellent interpersonal, written/oral communication and presentation skills, including full competence with Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint & Word)
  • Proven ability to work independently as well as collaboratively
  • Demonstrated ability to excel in an autonomous, hands-on, fast paced entrepreneurial environment
  • Highly adaptable & resourceful with a pioneering spirit
  • Proficient in Data Tools (SPINS, Nielsen, Retailer Portals), Microsoft Excel and Trade Analytics (selling price, margins, etc.)
  • Ability to travel extensively

Your Responsibilities Include

  • Directly call on major retailer’s headquarters
  • Build a strategic and collaborative annual trade promotion calendar for retail customers
  • Identify and execute on opportunities to expand the sales of Truvani across all Channels
  • Request and analyze distribution reports to determine market coverage and opportunities for future growth
  • Set performance expectations and manage all appointed brokers and distributors to achieve quality distribution in targeted accounts, timely execution of new item introductions, schematic implementation and promotional programming and ensure that they have all necessary resources required to succeed in the market place (e.g., product samples, sell sheets, promotional calendars, etc.)
  • Attend trade shows to represent the brand and develop sales opportunities
  • Identify opportunities to build strong connections with key individuals and form meaningful and impactful relationships to continue to drive growth, beyond distribution

  • Assist in the implementation, training, and auditing of brokerage teams and distributor territory reps to execute sell in and sell through initiatives
  • Utilize existing resources to run sales reports and analysis to support future sales initiatives and decisions
  • Manage relationships with key distributor buyers and supporting teams in the region

The Nitty Gritty

  • Full time market-based compensation based on experience
  • Health benefits offered after 60 days
  • Paid time off and paid holidays
  • Position is available immediately and will remain open until filled
  • This is a permanent position with an opportunity to grow within the company (so we would like to hire someone that is awesome and is excited about being a part of our team).

Remote | International

JOB SUMMARY

The Study Start Up Project Manager is responsible for defining, developing and delivery of the Global Study Start Up Project Plan by partnering with Study Manager, Clinical Trial Application Group, Clinical Research Site Assistants, CRO Study Start Up and Site Operations Relationship Lead and others as required for Phase 3 and other supported studies.

  • Partner with Study Optimization to leverage site intelligence to inform the Start Up Project Plan.
  • Partner with the Targeted Site Investigator Network Strategy Implementation Lead to ensure accelerated start up strategies are leveraged at Targeted sites.
  • Partner with Clinical Trial Application and CRO Start Up functions to align all country and site activities to Start Up Project Plan
  • Identify risks to site activation and develop mitigation plans. This role is also accountable for resolution of Site Activation escalations for Study Teams including offering options for mitigation (both at the study and site level).
  • Leader of the Study Start Up Subteam and a core member of the Study Management Operations Subteam.
  • Ad-hoc member of the Core Team Meeting throughout study start up.
  • Accountable for start up of sites to be Ready to Enroll.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Leader of the Site Activation Subteam and a core member of the Study Management Operations Subteam

  • Lead the cross functional site activation team – internal plus CRO, utilizing the appropriate team members to support implementation of the Start Up Project plan.
  • Ensure accelerated start-up for Targeted Sites leveraging the Site Operations Relationship Lead and Clinical Research Site Assistant.
  • Drive delivery of all Targeted and CRO supported sites that are “Ready to Enroll” to the Start Up Project plan.
  • Resolve escalated issues identified by the site activation subteam in partnership with the Study Manager through the Study Management Operations Subteam with the CRO.
  • Oversee and drive execution of study start-up activity at CRO.
  • Ensure alignment to the DVSO scenario planning.

Accountable for defining, developing and delivery of the Global Study Start Up Project Plan, including:

  • Track and communicate with Study Management Operations Subteam & Core Team.
  • Drive alignment of CRO study start up plan to country and site level.
  • Agree to deliverables on a site-level basis with the CRO and monitor adherence to these. Promptly recognize and remediate potential delays, and escalate non-performance as needed.
  • Use site activation reporting tool following site ID, up to and including, site Ready to Enroll, incorporating input from DCSM regulatory submission/approval timelines in order to achieve agreed upon milestones in DVSO.
  • Implement strategies within Study Start Up Subteam on assigned study to ensure consistent and efficient communications internally and with the CRO.
  • For PFE Targeted sites, drive the Site Operations Relationship Lead to manage site activation timelines across targeted sites to the level of the individual site:
    • Understanding critical path activities at the site level
      • Ensure planning for individual components of IIP documentation (including site contracts and budgets and ICD) in partnership with CRO Start Up and/or Clinical Research Site Assistants.
      • Ensure site readiness activities are considered in the overall timelines for each site to ensure ready to enroll
        • Supplies on site (IP and non clinical supplies)
        • Systems access
        • Training (break blind, systems training, etc.)
        • Translations

Leverage all available intelligence to inform the Study Start Up Strategy

  • Partner with Site Intelligence to ensure clear communication of data.
  • Obtain CRO, CTA, Country and Targeted Site level input to plans.

Identify risks to site activation and develop mitigation plans, including providing input to OpCo materials

  • Identify and capture key risks to site activation for inclusion in OpCo presentations.
  • Develop site activation mitigation plans and monitor effectiveness through Study Start Up Subteam.

Identify improvements and efficiencies to site activation processes and share lessons learned broadly with key stakeholders

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Extensive global clinical trial/study management experience
  • Working knowledge of Good Clinical Practices, monitoring, clinical and regulatory operations
  • Must have a BS/Nurse – 5 years relevant experience or MS/PhD – 3 years relevant experience

Prior Experience Preferred:

  • Demonstrated knowledge of site selection, site activation, site readiness interdependencies
  • Demonstrated experience leading cross functional teams
  • Demonstrated experience in Project Management activities and responsibilities
  • Previous CRO oversight experience

Skills:

  • Technical expertise in the use of Site Activation tools
  • Ability to manage complex processes
  • Ability to manage in a matrix environment
  • Risk Identification & Mitigation
  • Strategic Planning, Analytical and Problem Solving Skills
  • Critical Path Analysis
  • Country level awareness and strong interpersonal skills
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Must be fluent in English.
  • Detail oriented & possesses technical expertise (e.g.,PM tools, Gantt charts spreadsheets, metrics & data flow management)
  • Self motivated

Head of Sales
Based in London or South-East England

We want to empower people and companies to do transformative things using data. To enable our customers to do this, we have created both the technology and services to allow users to collect and own their own data, and to transform their business. Snowplow enables you to track any event data; ask any question of that data and use any tool you want to answer it.

As a company, we have almost doubled in size over the last 18 months and we’re not looking to slow down in 2019. To support our growth, we’re in the process of building out a consultative, forward-thinking sales function, which now needs a Head of Sales to help scale the team. The role would be a great fit for a sales professional who has recently successfully grown a Sales team from around 5 to 25 team members and is keen to do something similar again.

The Opportunity:
As our Head of Sales, you will be responsible for building, training and leading our energetic and ambitious Sales team. You’ll be working on our go to market approach, implementing sales strategies that help to propel our overall growth strategy forward and ensuring that every member of your team has the tools and support they need to succeed.

Sales doesn’t work in isolation so you’ll also be collaborating closely with our Marketing and customer-facing functions to ensure we have a well-thought-out, hugely positive customer journey from initial contact to onboarded user. We’re looking for someone with high levels of empathy with a passion for helping others. Our goal is to build a Sales team that is focused on empowering our users, our teams and each other.

The environment you’ll be working in:
Our company values are Transparency, Honesty, Ownership, Inclusivity, Empowerment, Customer-centricity, Growth and Technical Excellence. These aren’t just words we plucked out of thin air, we came up with them together as a company and are continually looking to find new ways to weave these into our day to day operations. From flexible hours and working locations to the way we give feedback, we’re passionate about building a company that supports both company and individual development.

What you’ll be doing:
Build, train and manage the Sales team
With the support of the Leadership Team, you’ll be implementing both short and long term sales strategies that will support growth at Snowplow
Gain a solid understanding of our business proposition in order to create training materials for our Sales team that clearly explain our value proposition and help to onboard new team members quickly and effectively
Create and update commission plans & structure, as well as the overall Sales team targets
Ensure every member of the Sales team has a high chance of achieving and exceeding their sales targets through education, successful onboarding and ongoing support
Utilise a confident command of pricing and negotiating multi-year deals to break into new customer market segments
Develop a consultative sales process, building relationships with leading companies in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Think creatively about how to minimise our cost of customer acquisition and how to also increase the lifetime value of our customers
Foster a safe, supportive environment where constant experimentation and learning are encouraged and we continually improve our processes
Present plans for sales strategy, team growth and progress to the Board

What you bring to the team:
Senior sales leadership experience within B2B SaaS or Enterprise Software environment, ideally for a high growth organisation Experience increasing sales revenue 4x
A ‘roll up your sleeves’ attitude, you lead by example
Deep knowledge of different sales methodologies and the ability to articulate their various benefits/limitations in line with Snowplow values & mission
Ability to set and successfully execute on sales strategy
Strong experience of hiring, training and scaling high-performing, consultative teams (ideally from around 5 to 25 team members)
Data-driven, you love to measure your team’s progress towards success
Comfortable driving alignment and predictable outcomes across a geographically distributed company
Fantastic negotiation skills; exceptional presentation and written skills
Customer-centric, you enjoy creating brilliant customer experience from start to onboarding
You love to inspire your team and help them to succeed in a fast-paced, growth environmentIntellectually curious, your driven to develop & embrace new best practices and support a learning culture
Combination of determination and empathy, you understand the importance of honesty and compassion in a sales process
Willing to travel approx 25% of time

What you’ll get in return:
A competitive package based on experience, including share options

Senior Projects Manager

Based in London

£35,000 - £45,000 + Benefits

Deadline: Sunday 23rd June 2019, 11:59pm

Application Method: CV and Covering Letter, both no more than 2 pages please.

Due to the high number of applications that we receive we are sadly unable to get back to everyone. If you haven’t heard from us by Wednesday 3rd July 2019, it means that you haven’t been successful this time.

Semble is looking for an experienced accounts / campaigns manager to lead on the delivery of high profile, purpose led projects and campaigns.

● Do you have two or more years clearly demonstrable experience delivering high profile projects or campaigns in a busy environment

● Are you self-motivated, resilient, and with bags of energy?

● Do you have a track record of working with existing clients and partners to develop new opportunities?

● Do you believe in the power of communities and corporations coming together and taking positive action to change the world?


If that’s four big ticks from you then you should definitely read on! If it isn't, please, please, please don't apply for this particular role. These are essential requirements, and we'd hate you to waste your time.

1. What is the purpose of this role?

Ultimately you will be responsible for delivering some of the high-profile campaigns and projects in Semble’s growing portfolio.

A close second to that will be a natural flair and passion for ensuring that Semble is constantly striving to be the best that it can possibly be.

Thirdly, you will also need to be comfortable with spotting new opportunities and developing those, with the support of the new business team.

2. What are the key responsibilities for this role?

To ensure campaigns and projects are delivered to time and to budget
To ensure contracts and finances are well managed
To report and evaluate impact of the campaign
To ensure data is managed securely
To constantly strive to improve systems and processes
To ensure all partners are supported and kept up to date with the campaign as a whole
Managing members of the delivery team

3. What are the minimum skills, knowledge and experience needed for this role?

At least 3 years’ experience of end-to-end management of large purpose-led or change programmes, projects or campaigns
Experience of managing a diverse team, preferably including remote management
Experience of successfully developing relationships with external and internal clients and stakeholders at all levels
A clear and demonstrable understanding of what the challenges are when working for a small business or start-up
Experience of developing complex project plans and comfortable managing budgets and performance in a target driven environment
Experience of working within a tightly knit team, but needing to be largely self-motivated
Experience of developing and improving processes, tools and systems
Experience of using data for analysing and reporting on performance of a large campaign
Skilled at thinking creatively to develop new approaches and materials to further engage external stakeholders
Ability to manage own workload effectively
Ability to manage a team and build effective processes
Ability to use initiative and draw on experience in dealing with day-to-day tasks, risks and challenges
Desirable skills, knowledge and experiences

Experience of data protection and GDPR
Experience within, or working with, the community sector
Knowledge or experience of marketing and communications theory and practise, particularly for digital.
Experience of fundraising or proposal writing
Experience of Theory of Change journey

4. About Semble and Our Community

Semble is the UK’s most active network of community projects with an online platform that currently hosts over 3,500 environmental and social projects. We connect community projects with local people and companies who want to help them to achieve their goals and join their story.

Our vision is: Bring people together to make a change

For the last five years, Semble has been growing its platform for community projects nationally and developing an impressive client base. We’re building the team, developing our brand and platform, and are now looking for someone to help us super-charge our community!

We run projects such as #Made Local, #GreenerwithGreggs (an environmental fund for Greggs), #GivexCollaborate (a team-based volunteering campaign for Dentsu Aegis Network), #YourPintCan (a neighbourhood investment fund for Carling), and Outdoor Classroom Day (a global day to get over 20m children outdoors to learn & play at school, in partnership with Unilever and a network of NGOs). Last year we ran the Offline Festival for community businesses.

5. Benefits & Further Details

In this role, you will be working closely with the Head of Client Campaigns and the wider team. You will have significant opportunities for personal development and play an important role in developing and nurturing our community.

We have a lot of fun, with drinks evenings, picnics & team away days. Community volunteering is actively encouraged with each team member having 2 days per year to volunteer, and at least 2 days to visit community projects to find out more about how Semble can help them, and to collect stories and content for social media and the Semble platform.

Other benefits include:
• £35,000 – £45,000 depending on experience
• Central London location, with option of working remotely for part of the time
• 25 days holiday allowance p.a.• 25 days holiday allowance p.a.
• Pension contribution
• Clear training opportunities and career path progression
• Discretionary bonus scheme, related to business performance
• Shared gym membership

No Recruitment Agencies please, you do a great job but we’ve got this one covered.

items.content:
Head of Marketing

Marketing
4 Hours Overlap with Chicago Time
Remote First Company
Company: Basecamp
Full Time

Overview

For the past 20 years, we’ve been passive arketers with a little .

mm

We speak at conferences and on podcasts, we write books (REWORK, REMOTE, It Doesn’t Have to be Crazy at Work), we share our point of view on thousands of blog posts, we invented a framework (Ruby on Rails) that changed an industry, and we make products that redefine their categories (Basecamp, Highrise, etc.). And right now we’re working on something new that’s going to surprise people.

We’ve gotten by on strength of product, cult of personality, a unique point of view, running against the wind, and incredibly generous word-of-mouth promotion from our customers. We’re fortunate it’s been working. 20 profitable years in business is the proof. We’re naturally proud of that.

But we feel like we’ve begun to saturate our natural sphere of influence, our current reach. Passive marketing can only get us so far, and we have a desire to go further. Today, if we’re in the mix, it’s by chance, not choice. And because of that, we feel a bit invisible outside of those who know us already.

And it’s no surprise: We haven’t really advertised. Or made it easy for new people to find us online. Lately we haven’t explained our brand particularly well. Or thought much about how we’re perceived in the modern market. We don’t show up in places where potential customers hang out, and we haven’t gone far enough supporting and sponsoring events and like-minded organizations. Basically, we’ve never deliberately focused on actively getting the word out, making sure our brand is positioned properly in the market, or meeting customers where they are.

We lack a Marketing strategy with a capital M. It’s time to change that.

Moving forward, we want to be intentional about creating awareness (how do we introduce Basecamp to people who don’t know us?), prompting consideration (how do we get people who need a product like ours to consider us for purchase?), and driving conversion (how do we get people who are considering Basecamp to sign up, pay us, and start using our products?).

So, for the first time, we’re ready to hire someone to lead that charge and own that responsibility. We’re looking for our first Head of Marketing.

How’s that challenge sound to you?

ABOUT THE JOB AND THE WORK

Fundamentally, this job is about developing and executing a broad strategy to bring more people to the front of the funnel by increasing awareness and interest outside of what we’ve already built. We’re not looking for somebody to spend time on email drip campaigns or improving onboarding. While important, this role is much broader than that. This also isn’t a job for self-described growth hackers.

This is a role for someone who knows how to mix a wild idea with a practical pitch. Someone who’s eager (but not annoyingly so) to pick up the phone and negotiate a major partnership deal. Someone who has an eye for talent, a nose for bullshit, ears close to the ground, and the creative mind of a conductor. Someone who’s previously managed large spends and helped a brand transition through a similar process. Someone who recognizes an opportunity when they see one, but knows how to steer clear of high effort low reward mirages. You see things other people miss, and you know how to put leverage to good use.

And while we’ll support your strategy with a multimillion dollar budget and creative support from the CEO, you’ll start this process without a dedicated internal team. While we have designers, writers, and a data analyst occasionally available to assist, we don’t have a marketing department or spare staff focused on everything you’ll need to get done. This means you’ll initially be expected to identify, vet, choose, and manage external vendors or agencies to help pull off your plan. Building an in-house team is something we’ll discuss down the road.

While some may see this as a disadvantage, we think it’s a big opportunity. You’ll be able to pull in the best agencies, freelancers, shops, and creative specialists to help pull off the plan. You’ll bring us creative ideas we’ve never considered in the past. You’ll challenge our thinking and help us see ourselves in a new light.

In addition to big picture strategy, you’ll focus on practical day-to-day work like fielding sponsorship opportunities that come our way. Keeping an eye on analytics. Reaching out to groups, organizations, movements, events, and other brands we should be partnering with. You’ll also be expected to regularly detail progress, setbacks, and marketing insights for the whole company.

We’re aware that at many companies, this is a multi-person position. Someone focused on the marketing strategy. Someone else focused on brand. Someone else focused on partnerships and sponsorships. And so on. We’re not expecting a herculean marketing turnaround with a single person at the start, but we absolutely believe the right person can point us in the right direction, guide us, come up with campaigns, be resourceful enough to get them produced, manage the process, study the results, course correct, revamp, and try more things. We know someone has to own this, or we’ll end up where we are today.

Bottom-line, this is an impact position. In time, the business should look better with you on board. A clear case of before and after. You’ll help us be noticed, be seen, and be found. We should also feel better about ourselves with you around. This is a big responsibility and we are here to support you, cheer you on, and make it happen. We’ve talked about having someone like you on board for years, and now we’re finally ready.

ABOUT YOU

You’ve done this before. You can’t wait to do it again. You absolutely want to do it for us.

We value people who can take a stand yet commit even when they disagree. We’ll often subject ideas to rigorous debate, so you’ll need to stand up for what you believe, but we remember that we’re here for the same purpose: to do good work together. Charging the trust battery is part of the work.

Yes, you’ll need to learn how we work at Basecamp, but we’re also looking for someone to teach us how to work. And once we’ve figured that out, be able to share that story with the world. We should tell the story of how we changed our approach to marketing.

We’re not looking for a superhero who thinks sheer hours = good work. Excess doesn’t impress us – creativity and efficiency does. You’ll have 8 hours a day to work, and, we hope, at least 8 hours a night to sleep. What you do with the other 8 is up to you, never to us. You’ll report directly to the CEO.

ABOUT OUR PAY AND BENEFITS

The salary for this position is $181,000. You can read about how we set salaries .

here

Our benefits are all aimed at supporting a life well lived away from work. None are about trapping people at the office or cajoling them into endless overtime. Just the opposite. We’re all about reasonable working hours, ample vacation time, summer hours, fitness, wellness, food, education, and charity. .

See the full list

Basecamp is a remote-work company so you can be anywhere, but you’ll need at least 4 hours of overlap with Chicago time in your normal work-day routine.

We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company. Basecamp is committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career.

HOW TO APPLY

Please send an application tailored to this position. Introduce yourself as a colleague. Show us that future.

We want to get a sense of how you think. To that end, please use your cover letter to share with us your take on the following questions:

  1. Tell us how you’ve taken an existing brand to a new place by revamping their approach to marketing. How would you begin to approach figuring out where we stand and where we should be standing?
  2. Give us an example of a small-to-medium sized business that you think markets themselves particularly well? Who’s doing an outstanding job out there? And why?
  3. Since you’ll need to bring in outside talent to get the job done, which creative agencies or freelancers do you think are doing particularly interesting work? And why?
  4. Share an example of a time great marketing caught your attention and turned you into a customer.
  5. Tell us about something you almost bought recently, but decided not to. What failed to convince you?
  6. What’s inspired you lately? What’s the most creative thing you’ve seen or experienced in the last few years?

    7. We value great writers, so take your time with the application. Keep in mind that we do not equate length with substance, so please keep your cover letter to fewer than 1500 words. Stock cover letters won’t do – tell us why you want  job, not just any job.

    this

    Go for it!

    We are accepting applications for this position until June 28th, 2019. We’ll let you know that we’ve received your application. After that, you probably shouldn’t expect to hear back from us until after the application deadline has passed. We want to give everyone a fair chance to apply and be evaluated.

    We can’t wait to hear from you!

    Apply for job
